Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed T
Reviews.Content: We spent time in Vancouver for the weekend. The hotel was amazing. Beautiful decor, clean, and tasteful. The staff were very hospitable and professional. The restaurant was amazing! Food was great! Have to try it. The room was very spacious and well appointed with high quality linens. Location was perfect. It was a quick walk to everything. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at this wonderful boutique hotel. Great location and fantastic attention to detail in all respects. Rooms are very well furnished and have their own balconies. Will definitely stay here again the next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, but out-of-site breakfast prices”
Reviews.Author: chefseye
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood is an elegant hotel with great service and impeccable rooms. But, don't go here if you need a decent exercise facility. The "steam room/sauna" was at best somewhat warmer than the hotel rooms. The spa facilities are small but very nice. Beware however if breakfast isn't included in your room rate (which we booked through hotels.com). Coffee, juice, a very small goblet of fruit and spoonful of yogurt and a single pastry was $22.00 per person. With tax, my husband and I had a nearly $50.00 continental breakfast. We didn't realize it wasn't included in our rate until we were presented with the bill. Starbucks is next door, and the same breakfast, only more, would have been 1/4 the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Quite fabulous”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyATraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wedgewood twice over a span of two weekends. For the first visit I was in a one bedroom suite... generously large by Vancouver standards... with an excellent hideabed mattress for my daughter. The second visit found me in a standard room... also spacious and refined. Breakfast at Bacchus was included both times, along with free valet parking. Location downtown was unbeatably close to Robson St shopping (1/2 block), restaurants like Coast and Joe Fortes (2 blocks), Vancouver Art Gallery (2 blocks), and Rogers Arena (7 blocks). I got a deal through the hotels website that was excellent. We look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite places to be!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura99_11
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood Hotel is one of my favourite places to be! When it comes to service, value, atmosphere, professional/friendly staff, large, well equipped rooms, you will not find a better hotel. From the moment you enter the front lobby you can feel the pressures of your day wash away. We always enjoy the service and food quality at The Bacchus lounge and restaurant. (The restaurant is on the higher end but for a special occasion it is the best!) The hotel is very central to all that Vancouver has to offer!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne1209
Reviews.Content: My husband spent a few days of R&R here after climbing Mt Rainer, before joining family on an Alaska Cruise. Our room was lovely and so was the staff. We enjoyed some much needed pampering in the skilled hands of the spa staff. The location is perfect for walking to shops, museums and wonderful restaurants. Great location to go for morning runs to Stnley Park and surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: KellyMcAree
Reviews.Content: I was staying attending Relais & Chateaux Conference this past January. I was provided with a very comfortable large room, quiet for the city. The staff were all very friendly even guiding me right to a nearby museum for a function. The food in the Bacchus Restaurant was excellent and I was greeted by a smile and a friendly hello by all staff I encountered. As an fellow hotelier I appreciate a job well done, so well done Wedgewood!

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, cozy boutique hotel. I had a standard room and it was very spacious. The linens and the bed were absolutely luxurious! The balcony was not your usual step out...it was huge with room for a table and chairs -- would have been wonderful to sit outside in the summer. The hotel is close to Robson street so lots of shopping and restaurant choices -- really nice area. The lobby and lounge are beautiful with an old world feel. The chocolates in the room and the welcome note from the hotel owner were nice. The front desk and restaurant staff were nice and helpful...and so was the doorman who worked there in the morning. The younger staff who were at the door in the afternoon could brush up a bit on customer service...no offer of assistance with my luggage, no eye contact or greeting as i reached the door--basically it seemed that they did not want to be there...it was a little annoying.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Princeway
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and would recommend it highly. The service and food is superb and the staff very friendly. Within walking distance to many places in central Vancouver and just across from the Vancouver Art Gallery. Were lucky enough to get upgrades because of being a repeat client. My daughter first told us about it over ten years ago and we have not had any complaints. When we were there last spring we were fortunate to get a room with a huge private terrace and even though it wasn't warm enough to be outside - we sat out there with our coats on because it was so pleasant. The cookies, chocolates and note from the owner are just added touches.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Jakki G
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay in the hotel as part of a show and Hotel package during this year's comedy Fest. It's location was great, close to the Ford Center as well as other Vancouver attractions. The quiet elegance of their front entrance was a nice surprise. The upgraded room (junior executive suite) as well as the perks (chocolate and homemade cookies) were all very appreciated. The staff were all very charming and helpful, and went out of their way to make us feel special. Their spa is second to none... Thanks Wedgewood for participating in the Vancouver Comedy Fest.... look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: JackandDebbie27
Reviews.Content: Recently, my wife and I made the most of the Wedgewood Hotel and Spa's tempting Vancouver dine-out and hotel stay package to celebrate a memorable birthday and be centrally located walking tourists in our own remarkable town. Not only did we delight in a well-appointed view room, we also savoured the best the hotel's Bacchus Lounge and Restaurant offer: hearty breakfasts, fine dining by candlelight and those special dry martinis that never fail, especially with tuneful piano accompaniment, to keep winter chills at bay. From reservations and valet / front desk service, from check-in to departure, we felt our Friday afternoon through Sunday morning experience was elegant, special, simply superb!

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 star hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: maurice065
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Vancouver on business for many years and this hotel was my favorite. When making my reservations for my trips to Vancouver if no rooms were available at the Wedgewood I would change the date of my trip. The location is ideal just next to Robson street and a short walk from the bay. This boutique hotel pampers the guests. By far the best 5 star hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “So far, my favourite”
Reviews.Author: tylervancouver
Reviews.Content: Comfy and quiet. The staff were super friendly and knowledgeable. I think this is the first time I've been to a hotel and couldn't find ANYTHING to complain about. Everything worked! and everything was nice and clean. The complimentary chocolates and cookies were a very nice touch and a BIG bathtub for two, not in the bathroom, but IN the room itself. The hotel restaurant, Bacchus, had delicious food and good staff. Can't say enough good about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We never want to go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TheHamms
Reviews.Content: My sister and I travel for business to Vancouver up to 7 times a year. We cannot say enough good things about our experience at this hotel. The staff are fantastic and you could not find better doormen anywhere else! (They know us by name.) We love the cozy atmosphere, and the Bacchus Lounge is a great place for drinks before/after dinner. You can just sit and relax by the fire and listen to the amazing live piano music(not sure if they do this every night or just the weekends.) Right out the front door to your left is Robson street with tons of shopping, or Pacific Center Mall if it is raining. It is a great location. Our room is always clean, and lovely with fresh cookies & a bottle of water at night after your turn down service. *If your lucky you might spot a celebrity or two...

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite home away from home”
Reviews.Author: arneg
Reviews.Content: We live in the Vancouver area and whenever my wife and I do date night we stay here. Make sure you get one of the rooms with the tub in the room (wink wink) Great resturaunt and the staff are really happy and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: scout29
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I have stayed at the Wedgewood a few times for both business and pleasure. This past November, my husband and I stayed here for a long weekend, and we enjoyed this hotel a fair amount. The location is very good - near the art gallery, shopping, and walking distance (or a short cab ride) to many restaurants. However, we both felt the hotel is in need of some renovation. It's not changed in a decade (at least, possibly longer), and some of the fixtures and decore are dated. Also, our room was near the elevator, despite having asked for a quiet room. This was a disappointment. Still, the service was very good, and our room had a nice view of the park. We enjoyed our time, but would in the future likely choose a hotel that was either built for or updated as a result of the Olympics. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families. I did not use the gym, but my husband did. He said it that calling it a gym is a stretch - more of a work-out bathroom really.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: doreenandneil
Reviews.Content: This is a superb "boutique" hotel well located in the center of the city. It is right in the shopping and business district and close to tourist attractions. The staff are first rate. The Bacchus Restaurant in the hotel is over the top; the food is top notch and the setting is romantic. Cookies and chocolates were provided in the room at the end of the day and a newspaper was hung on the door in the morning. There was free in room WiFi. This was our second visit. The room was a delux King that was exceptionally well appointed. We plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Same time next year!”
Reviews.Author: humbug31
Reviews.Content: Every year we visit the wedgewood, for a birthday celebration and a romantic weekend away. Staying here is a wonderful jump start to the holiday season. Rooms with soak tubs are wonderful, getting a room facing east you get the wonderful Christmas lights of the trees outside. this was our 12 year, so we will be back,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel, superb service, wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: melissanakhle
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel with the most superb service. From the doorman to the concierge. A quiet comfortable room, bed lovely touches chocolate chip cookies yummy.

Reviews.Title: “The Wedgewood Vancouver is 5 STAR”
Reviews.Author: BigWhale
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this wonderful boutique hotel for 4 days and loved every minute of it....the 12th Floor Penthouse Suite overlooking the park is just fantastic.....everything is just nothing short of perfection.....service, amenities and even the incredible location. Just a few steps from parks, attractions & shopping....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well appointed room”
Reviews.Author: Tmirelle
Reviews.Content: An amazing stay, staff are so warm & gracious. Wish I could give the service more stars

Reviews.Title: “Quaint boutique hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: schayward
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Wedgewood is the location. It is right across the street from the Vancouver Art Museum and one block from world class shopping. The hotel itself is small but inviting and has a very proper english vibe. It is luxurious without being too over the top. The rooms are small but very nice and the bathrooms seem newly updated. The restaurant/bar downstairs had good food and fun live music at night. The staff is very friendly and helpful, so much that you feel like they know you as soon as you check in. The workout facility was a bit small as it was tucked into one small area just past the spa and it only offered one treadmill, one bike, one eliptical machine and a small weight set. Overall a very nice hotel that has a great location downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SandEWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Cozy room, nice comfort touches. Love that they have valet parking. The hotel is very close to restaurants and shopping. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Inviting Experience”
Reviews.Author: kayakgirlseattle
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood Hotel staff could not have been more accommodating or welcoming. Very good location in the heart of the city within walking distance to Central Waterfront, Yaletown, and the popular Robson Street. My husband I escaped from Seattle for two days here in early November. Fall color was wonderful and our one full day there was sunny and warm (it doesn't always rain on the Northwest Coast). Bed was comfortable, hotel quiet, room was clean and well appointed. We like to be casual and wear our jeans and sneakers almost everywhere and even though this hotel is very luxurious we felt right at home in the lobby and public spaces of the hotel. This is pretty true throughout Vancouver BC though...also true in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm Modern Comforts”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: A most wonderful experience. Felt very safe and comfortable (I was traveling alone). Loved the old fashioned character, charm and location - easy to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: GulfSider
Reviews.Content: I stayed five days for a business trip. This is a great hotel, not too large and not too busy. Excellent location within walking distance to almost everything downtown. Room was on the 8th floor with a long balcony and large windows with a decent view. Nice clean two room suite with a good bar and a few stools along with the normal furnishings. The two elevators were very efficient and easily handled the hotel traffic, in fact I couldn't really tell if the hotel was full or not since the elevator was almost always empty. I do hate a long wait for elevators. The fine dining area (Bacchus) and bar share a menu and the food is slightly above average, not bad, but nothing to write home about. However, the bar did have great entertainers most nights of the week and was fairly lively. Wireless was very weak in my room and ended up costing me roaming fees for using my phone. This was the only issue I had with my entire stay, but it wasn't enough to rate them less than perfect. The employees were friendly and professional at all times. A truly great stay, would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation & Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TrevLaur
Reviews.Content: My family surprised me by coming to Vancouver to visit and putting me up at the Wedgewood with them. So first I was lucky to have my family come for a visit, and second I was lucky to stay at the Wedgewood. The hotel is really beautiful. Definitely upscale but very unpretentious. I'm a casual person and don't like to go somewhere where I feel uncomfortable. I'd just written a week's worth of exams so didn't feel or look my best when I arrived. But no matter how I looked or felt, I was made to feel at home and very welcome by the staff at The Wedgewood. The rooms are beautiful and have a European feel to them. We didn't get a chance to use the big soaker tub in the room, but with more time I definitely would've indulged. We did, however, book deep tissue massages at the Spa located inside the hotel and I couldn't be more glad that we did because they were AMAZING. The massage was very necessary after the stress of exams and the using the steam room beforehand was invigorating, to say the very least. We had dinner at Bacchus Lounge on our first night and the food & service were impeccable. I'm on a very restrictive diet at the moment and the chef was more than accommodating when I had to make numerous adjustments to the menu items. Everything tasted fantastic and was beautifully prepared. Our entire party of seven were very pleased with their meals. I cannot wait to stay at the Wedgewood again! Look no further when deciding where to stay in our beautiful city of Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, great staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelLib
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful 36 hours in Vancouver and the Wedgewood Hotel & Spa was a big part of the weekend. Trusting the reviews, we booked a junior suite that was absolutely lovely. Great use of space in this place! The bed was just right--I like it a little firmer than my husband and we were both happy with this. A few little niggling problems were fixed upon reporting. And the spa was an unexpected delight. Definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “cookies,smiles and service”
Reviews.Author: lactmama
Reviews.Content: I second the reviews that were put up about this hotel. I managed to get a good rate for the three nights that three of us were at the hotel. No real view but well appointed rooms and good beds. Wi fi and tv worked, etc The staff is wonderful, people remember your name and what you like. I fell in love with one of the staff, Wanda, the Breakfast Goddess, she remembered what we like to eat and had it waiting for us when we went down in the morning. Lovely, kind lady, who deserves special mention. All of the staff were nice and seemed surprised and grateful to be tipped tho I saw others tipping them as well. A well trained group of people. Hotel is in the middle of a busy commercial section as are most of the hotels, no parking on the street and yes, everything, but everything, is expensive in Vancouver. Hotel is a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely staycation”
Reviews.Author: JnTTravelots
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a birthday weekend at the Wedgewood. I booked on the special occasion package that they offer and we weren't disappointed at all. We were in a deluxe executive room on the 9th floor. The bed was really confortable and the shower was great. We got a voucher for the Bacchus restaurant which was fantastic. Well worth it even without the voucher. The continental breakfast was included with the package and started our mornings off on the right foot. My husband enjoyed a pot of coffee and I enjoyed a hot chocolate with our yogurt parfaits and two pasteries each. We sat and slowly had our breakfast as we people watched from comfy leather chairs and read the complimentary newspaper. The service was first rate and everyone greeted us with a smile. Thanks to everyone at the Wedgewood for making my husband's birthday a truly special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like family”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel1961
Reviews.Content: I choose the Wedgewood hotel due to Trip Advisor reviews & location. It is close to everything. We were close to busy Robson Street, the Vancouver Art Gallery, Skytrain & lots of great shopping. Check in was a breeze with extremely friendly staff from the doorman to the front desk. Everyone I ran into while at the hotel smiles. We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 8th floor which was spacious. The lounge area includes a bar & desk with lots of seating & lamps everywhere + an oversized balcony. Flat screen tv's & free WIFI is a bonus. The king bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. Great water pressure in the shower and lots of space in the bathroom. The decor of the hotel reminded me of staying in a London hotel. They even have afternoon tea. If you can think of something you need in a hotel room, they have it. Mini bar, snacks, coffee maker (with cream & milk in the fridge) Iron, full sized hairdryer, slippers & gown, safe, umbrella, newspaper etc. There was bottled water & cookies at night. We ate dinner in the Bacchus restaurant. It was busy & the bar was full with a great piano player. The menu had something for everyone. They served my son a pizza which was not on the menu. The steaks were cooked to perfection. I have a wonderful facial at the spa & used the stream room which was great. The Wedgewood is luxury without being stuffy and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Don G
Reviews.Content: As a resident of the lower mainland my wife and I were looking for a nice hotel to spend a night out downtown Vancouver. The Wedgewood certainly delivered. Excellent service from start to finish. The staff was very respectful and very prompt with all of our requests. A truely upscale experience. The location is perfect in the heart of downtown there is access to all of the shops and restaurants you could imagine just by walking out the front door. We capped our evening with a drink in the Bacchus lounge - a relaxing atmosphere with live piano. A great spot to conclude a romantic evening. Classy, excellent service, great rooms. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Elegance in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Harrydog44
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood is a classic, wood-paneled, elegant city hotel. The staff is the hotel's major asset. They have the uncanny ability to make a guest feel like a family member without the rough patches that turn up in family relationships. In other words, flawless service that is so smooth that it doesn't feel like service. Our suite was spacious and very well appointed, and the restaurant, Bacchus, is worth a trip even if you aren't staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As close to home as you can get in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kentito
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vancouver and we lucked out with the Wedgewood recommendation. The room amenities are first class. The staff is friendly and well informed. The location is great for seeing the city and after a long day you feel at home once you come through the doors. The restaurant is excellent. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service, nice piano bar”
Reviews.Author: Sally L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated down town close to the art museum. Upon arrival, we were given a suite on the 8th floor. The hallway to the suite and the suite itself both smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. To the hotels credit we were quickly transferred to a suite on the 6th floor - where this problem did not exist. We had a nice balcony - that was a good length and spotlessly clean, and the bathroom was modern - and the shower had great water pressure, but the bedroom and living room both showed their age. The living room was narrow and the TV armoire crowded the room from one side and the oversized 1990's type couch from the other. In my opinion, the room furnishings need to be updated - while maintaining a classical look, and the wet bars - with drop ceilings definitely need "work". We had dinner at the hotel, our waiter was attentive and the dinner was very good, but nothing about it was truly memorable. (Nothing stood out as being unusual, creative, or the best ever) With all of that said, the service throughout the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: trro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Wedgewood and it is a really great hotel, the service was outstanding and extremely friendly, we ate in the restaurant twice and the food was fabulous both times, The bar is really vibrant pretty much any time, which gives it a really nice atmosphere during dinner there is a piano player that adds to the ambiance. I can definitely recommend this hotel. Just be aware it really is not cheap so you must be prepared for the price, even though it is expensive, if I ever return to Vancouver I will definitely stay at the wedgwood again. Also the hotel staff are all young however the guests generally seem to be a little older.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: des124
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Wedgewood for four nights while visiting Vancouver. It's a wonderful and quiet place to come home to after a long day of hiking and sightseeing. A little bit older and more sedate than the larger hotels but that is part of its charm. The staff is very helpful and accomodating. A suggestion - if you are thinking of going to Whistler for the day, Avis is only one block away and it is an easy drive. They open at 7:00am and have late night drop off arrangements. You can stay at the Wedgewood and still have a full day in Whistler without changing hotels. Special rates are sometimes available for the Wedgewood and, if you can find one, you can stay in a nice luxury boutique hotel for about the same price or only a little more than the mass market ones the cruise lines use.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful oasis in bustling Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: greybees
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Wedgewood and found it delightful. Our room, 8th floor, was large and handsomely furnished and equipped. The staff was friendly and efficient. A fine continental breakfast was provided each morning. Our meals at the in-house lounge/restaurant - the Bacchus-- - were excellent. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver and looking for a special place to spend some time enjoying.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Misselly11
Reviews.Content: The Bacchus bar/lounge/restaurant is so civilized. I find this type of boutique hotel charming and as a single for the most part traveller I feel very safe here. It is a perfect location. The welcome box of chocolates are superb and the evening turndown with cookies and water is so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and location with Mother in tow”
Reviews.Author: superchiklit
Reviews.Content: To me the quality of a person shows when they engage with their Elders. If the Wedgewood were a person they would have strong character. This was an ideal location to bring my 78 year old mother on her first vacation in over 30 years. She was treated like gold by the staff who worked very hard to ensure she had everything she needed. The valet staff always welcomed her, remembered her walker before we had a chance to think of it, helped her in and out of doors. We were both tickled by the hand written note and box of chocolates in our room upon arrival. This classically decorated hotel thinks of everything from sound proofed glass on the windows overlooking the bustling Robson Square to warm cookies at bed time. The views were great for people watching but easy enough to get out and about to Robson street and see equally great people milling about. The high tea was a highlight but don't forget the spa. My spa treatments were incredible. Valet parking was a breeze and a deal for this city. It is wheelchair accessible but the ramp is in the lounge, a minor inconvenience. Very helpful & professional staff. I highly recommend this intimate hotel where service is the order of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Overall quite good”
Reviews.Author: MBKNJ
Reviews.Content: A very well run hotel without some of the annoying "cool" factor that affects some of the newer properties in the City. Highly professional and pleasant service. Rooms are a bit frayed at the seams - carpet, upholstery, furniture all a bit dated and ready for an upgrade, but the location is superb, and overall experience very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Best lounge, best location, loved the bedtime chocolates!”
Reviews.Author: CandiceWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an incredible boutique hotel for adults that provides a comfy British decor. The lounge is a perfect spot to catch up on the news with good friends over a bottle of wine and appetizers. The valet service is impeccable and adds to a stress free time in Vancouver. The location of the hotel is convenient for people who have appointments at the nearby St. Paul's Hospital and I like to be close to the shopping at Pacific Centre Mall. The beds are comfortable and we appreciated the bedtime chocolates with the turndown service. We initially had trouble operating the television and phoned the front desk. Within minutes, a maintenance person was at our door and quickly fixed the problem. The business centre was always free so we could access our emails quickly. If you can afford this luxury, it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “If you like "boutique" you'll love the Wedgewood!”
Reviews.Author: imafloridacracker
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor has rarely given us bad advice in our travels and very definitely was spot on about the Wedgewood! This property was on par with such boutique wonders like the Rusty Parrot in Jackson Hole and the Covent Garden Hotel in London. In fact, when we walked in and were greeted by every member of the staff, and then saw the Bacchus restaurant/bar, we remarked how reminiscent of the Covent Garden it seemed. The only disappointment was the size of the spa which had few facilities besides some treatment rooms, but the treatments and technicians were SUPERB! Extremely convenient downtown location allowed us to walk to a lot of places and loved the energy and everything about it!

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket!”
Reviews.Author: KenVicLee
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research before picking this hotel for my wife's and my 19th anniversary. We had never been to Vancouver, weren't sure we would ever visit again, so we wanted to make the most of our four night stay. The criteria that sold me on Wedgewood were balconies, piano bar and location. And by location I mean central to all the neighborhoods by foot since we did not intend to rent a car. As for the piano bar, the fact that the hotel's Bacchus Lounge was listed as the best hotel bar in Vancouver meant we always had a place to retreat to at the end of the day. The Wedgewood is nearly at the apex of Granville Street (which comes in from the airport) and Robson Street (which is the popular shopping district). From there my wife and I hoofed it to Gas Town, China Town, Yale Town and the West End, none being much farther than one mile. While we didn't use public transportation, the Vancouver City Centre Station was perhaps a block and a half away. A mere five minute walk past the Museum of Art and Robson Park. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a suite upon check-in. My only regret is that our room did not face Robson Park. But we weren't there to look down on the street scene so much as to be part of the street scene so the added space of the suite was appreciated. As you would expect of a 4 star boutique hotel, service was first class. The bell hop met us at the curb and by asking our name, the receptionist already had our reservation pulled up when we approached to check-in. Thereafter, while we never saw the maid, our room was tidied up when we departed for the day and the turn down service included fresh cookies when we returned for the night. My wife's favorite thing was the spacious, marbled bathroom with both a cozy Jacuzzi tub and ample tiled shower stall. After a long day walking my wife assured me that the Jacuzzi jets were a nice way to rejuvenate her body as well as her soul. Finally, did I mention Bacchus Lounge? That is where Danny and Stacy, bartenders extraordinaire, offered plenty of local insight about things to do and places to be while we were in town. In addition they offered up local micro-brewed beer and refreshing cocktails. We also bent the ear of Tamara and Leann, the lounge waitresses, to get their favorites for breakfast and dinner. We walked by the various Fairmonts, the waterfront Westin, the Pan Pacific and the top rated L'Hermitage. For our money we believe we picked the best property for our long weekend trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Small colonial hotel,great staff,very clean,great location,super food”
Reviews.Author: Warakorn123
Reviews.Content: I wish every hotel was managed like that, Philippe De Moor,t/l Master tours Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dunstable
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay in Vancouver. Beautiful small Relaix & Chateaux hotel. Our room was lovely with great amenities - even a box of chocolates. Great location in the downtown area - easy walk to most everything. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always our choice”
Reviews.Author: thefrasers97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at The Wedgewood countless times over the years and would not think of staying anywhere else.Ideally located in the heart of Vancouver this elegant boutique hotel is a delight.From the exceptionally well trained staff to the sumptuous meals served in Bacchus make this our #1 choice when in town. The suites are well appointed,spotlessly clean spacious enough to entertain in when needed.Bedding and linens are of the highest quality however,more importantly,comfortable. Our Granchildren love the homemade goodies left at turndown as we do too! The Wedgewood never disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with one limitation”
Reviews.Author: Merebruin
Reviews.Content: We were excited about staying at a hotel belonging to the Relais & Chateaux chain since we had not stayed at one in a while. Many aspects of the experience met our expectations. We had a nicely decorated small suite, and we found the valets who park the cars to be exceptionally friendly and helpful. We have folding bikes that we need to have stored, so we are more of a bother than most people to that part of the staff. But these men were full of good advice and cheerfully helped us whenever we asked. Also the restaurant is beautiful with a pleasant staff and good food. Our only real complaint was about the toilet in the bathroom of our suite. It leaked. Water formed around the hinges of the seat and on the floor of the room. We were told at the desk that condensation is a problem in Vancouver and that caused a problem with toilets. It is strange that we have stayed in Vancouver a half dozen times and never had this problem before. Housekeeping did put towels around the base of the toilet and controlled the situation somewhat. But I think that when the client is paying well in excess of $300 per night, the bathroom should function correctly. They did half heartedly offer to move our room, but indicated that all of the toilets had this problem, some less than others. Because of this problem, we would not stay at this hotel again.l

Reviews.Title: “Great urban boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CNShaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wedgewood for two nights in July and were very impressed. The rooms are very big for a city centre hotel and well appointed. Beds wonderful! We did not eat at the restaurant but only because the hotel is so centrally placed that we ate out all of the time. A special mention should go to the front desk staff who were really friendly, helpful and smartly turned out. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “High end with personal attention”
Reviews.Author: eich44
Reviews.Content: WE loved this hotel. The people were quite nice and helpful at the desk. Service was impeccable and our rooms were quite large with a balcony. Great location and the bar restaurant is awesome with the windows opened up onto the street- felt like a quaint French hotel. It earns it's Relais Chateau rating.

Reviews.Title: “Wanting a romantic hotel? stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: darniro
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at this hotel in the last 2 years. We always stay in the deluxe executive,and it is first class, (especially for romantic escapes). The hotel is perfectly located just off of robson street, which is perfect for shopping and checking out downtown restaurants. The executive room is spacious, well lit, and the bathtub for two in the corner of the room is spectacular. We try to book when the free valet parking and breakfast at Baccus. We have stayed at many downtown hotels (pan pacific, wall centre, sutton place) but this is the best of the lot, and we will continue to stay there. On one of our stays, the hotel didn't live up to the bar they had set for themselves. I contacted the manager, and he pleaded with us to let them make it up to us, and make it up they did, in a BIG way.. The whole Wedgewood experience starts when you walk into the warm, inviting lobby. As you get off the elevator, the hallways smell of spiced pot pouri. The hotel rooms are very clean, and I would recommend this place to anyone wanting a romantic getaway...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Jmiachika
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for five nights and the entire experience was perfect! This renowned property is perfectly located and beautufully maintained. The incredible staff take one's stay to another level, not common these days.

Reviews.Title: “We have nothing but praise for this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arundeltraveller
Reviews.Content: The service is exceptional and very friendly. The staff anticipate your every need. We enjoyed the continental breakfast, which was included. Also ate a snack meal there and a full dinner, both of which were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: Ringocat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wedgewood in a junior suite on the 14th floor. The hotel is beuatiful, had a balcony with a view, the staff was incredible, and lot's of restaurants and shopping with a few blocks. Some of the stores are open 24 hours so it feels safe walkiing downtown any time. Parking was $24/night at the hotel but it's expensive at any of the other lots downtown so you might as well park at the hotel. We didn't go to the spa because of the prices. The desk clerk said that most places would not accept American money and she offerred to exchange at a 10% penalty. I exchanged once just to get tip money, but all of the shops accepted US money at even rates. My credit card charged 3% exchange fee, which is in line with the currrent exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent finish to our Canadian Trip”
Reviews.Author: City-Break-Lover
Reviews.Content: A real bit of luxury in Downtown Vancouver. We had been touring Canada for nearly three weeks when we arrived at The Wedgewood and it was so good to have such a beautiful place to stay at this point. The staff were so helpful, polite and had a 'can do' attitude. The room, which was lovely, was smaller than we thought we were getting but the Manager was really helpful and said we could move the following day. We decided not to bother as we felt settled. We had a little balcony which was good to look out onto Vancouver especially as it was on the corner so we had a 'wrap around ' view. The bathroom was small but very well fitted out. Complimentary water and cookies were delivered each evening by a delightful member of staff. We also had a complimentary newspaper left on the door each day. We ate in the Bacchus Restaurant in the hotel on the first night and that was excellent. Breakfast was included in the price and was a very pleasant buffet breakfast. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to feel "Special" this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: iamcally
Reviews.Content: Vancouver has so many great hotel options that it was difficult to choose. We chose the Wedgewood because it ranked high with Trip Advisor AND because it was recommended by two different couples we ran into while traveling who are Vancouver locals. From the moment you arrive at the entry untilnthe day you depart you are treated as a celebrity. We had a King Suite for a week as this was a special 25 th Anniversary celebration. Vancouver was our original honeymoon destination so we were excited to return. Wow! This is a boutique hotel. The rooms are lovely and comfortable. The bed pillows were awesome as were the linens. Fresh cookies were delivered every evening as was ice. Coffee was replenished twice a day if needed. The hotel bar is upscale but comfortable and inviting. Guests are treated to live piano music (Elton John/Billie Joel style) every evening. The Wedgewood is in the heart of downtown and not on the water so the views are more reminiscent of city culture vs. the harbor. It is an easy walk every where. The only cab ride we took was from and back to the airport. Vancouver offers many, many great restaurants sand many of them are in the downtown area near this restaurant. There is shopping all around the hotel. LV, Gucci, Hermes or head in another direction for China town and street vendors.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Fantastic service, great hotel and brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: Naomi19
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here for our first few nights in Canada on our honeymoon. We could not have picked a better place. The service was incredible. Everyone is so friendly. My husband bought a baseball bat and ball and was even offered a game- it totally won him over!! The rooms were large, comfy and very clean. We had a large balcony and enjoyed looking down on the bustling street. We loved this place so much we came back two more times during our road trip!!! I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, central location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: humin32
Reviews.Content: Picked the Wedgewood Hotel for a short Vancouver vacation based on reviews here as well as Yelp.com. The Wedgewood is a smaller boutique hotel nestled among some stiff competition. The location is very central to Vancouver, once you get your bearings it's very doable to walk most places. Our room was on the 12th floor with a larger than you might expect veranda. The veranda had several large potted plants, round glass table and 4 chairs. A nice place to have a coffee in the AM or a cocktail in the afternoon. The bed was comfortable, room was equipped with a flat screen TV, and wifi is provided. Room as well as the rest of the hotel are tastefully decorated. Evening turn down included two fresh cookies every evening. The highlight of the Wedgewood was the staff. Every single staff member we encountered was friendly and very helpful. This type of service really set the Wedgewood apart from the majority of hotels we've stayed in (at this price point). If you stay here you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmaw09
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews for a last minute night away, and were very happy with the choice. The hotel is lovely, well appointed, and the rooms were beautiful. We had a great view of downtown Vancouver, and really enjoyed the room. The only small problem was that our room was not ready at check in, but they switched our floors and brought us to a room as quickly as possible. We had lunch and drinks in the attached restaurant which also has a great atmosphere. We were able to walk throughout downtown very easily. Great choice, and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Wedgewood is marvelous”
Reviews.Author: GHgrrl
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Wedgewood every few years since around 1990, and it has delighted us every time. The location is excellent, with Robson St right around the corner, and the Bill Reid Foundation's gallery and the Vancouver Art Gallery (don't miss the special exhibit on Surrealist Art and its connections to the art of NW coast peoples) right down the street. Taxis in Vancouver are a bargain and easy to find, so it's simple to get to and from restaurants and more distant shops. The staff at the front desk are superb, cheerfully fulfilling special requests, giving excellent recommendations on touristic activities, and handling suggestions and reservations for restaurants with complete accuracy. They also adjust their information depending on how much the guest already knows about a subject - so much nicer than being recited a standard "script". The junior suites with balcony are spacious, well-decorated and functional. The box of Daniel chocolates and the nightly fresh cookies were delicious! Although our bathroom was not large, it had a fine soaking tub. We ate breakfast each morning at Bacchus and had exceptional service from the waitstaff. Eggs Benedict with crab cakes really can't be improved upon! It is also really pleasant to sit at the table in the front corner on a sunny summer Saturday when the floor-to-ceiling windows are open. For a completely different experience, have Christmas dinner there - we did that in 2006, and it was wonderful! I can't imagine staying anywhere other than the Wedgewood while in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very realxing but pricey”
Reviews.Author: RichHB
Reviews.Content: Stayed in March 2010 but not an option on menu bar above for a review that old - Just revisiting old pics so thought I should review hotel - great location - great staff - great food - not cheap

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: HolidayJunkie99
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Good sized room, which seemed to have been recently refurbished. Bathroom looked new. Good location, close to the main shopping area and walkable to everything. Good restaurant recommendations from the staff. Nice bar and restaurant in the hotel, too. Seemed more intimate and friendly than the other top-end hotels in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Europe in Canada”
Reviews.Author: SueKot
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent European-style hotel in Vancouver. It was a repeat visit and the positive views we formed on our previous visits were enhanced. Front desk staff were more than helpful, especially when we left some clothing behind which was found and sent to us very efficiently. The location is excellent, sufficiently away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk everywhere in the centre. The room, a junior suite, was large and very comfortable with separate living and sleeping areas. The biscuits at turndown are a small sign of the delicate touches that the hotel provides. All-in-all another good visit.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favourite Hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: jannag23
Reviews.Content: I discovered the Wedgewood here on TripAdvisor around three months ago and have since stayed there four times for a variety of reasons and with a different mix of rooms. This hotel has quickly become my preferred Hotel when I visit Vancouver, knocking Sutton Place, The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver and Hyatt out of my top preferred Hotels in the area. The location is perfect! With some of my favourite restaurants all around (The Bellagio or Cactus club for casual and quick, Don Francesco's for a Risotto, Starbucks or Tim's for Coffee...the list goes on!) and Pacific Centre, chapters, and other Robson street shopping just a block away. The Skytrain is your link to everything entertainment and is just a block in either direction. The staff is exceptional. Friendly, bright, chatty, helpful, and genuinely pleasant to talk to. Above all the staff at the Wedgewood is what makes this hotel so very different from others in the area. Most hotels you just want to get through the lobby and to your room with maybe the odd exception to the rule; here at the Wedgewood we find ourselves linger in the lobby to chat with the Valet, Concierge, or desk staff for a moment or two. When you return from an outing they want to know how it was? What did you find at the shops or how was the hockey game? With the Wedgewood I always feel like I'm visiting family, and the box of chocolates at check-in and nightly turn down service with a bottle of water and some cookies sure does help that along! If I could change one thing about the Wedgewood I would take two of their fabulous beds and make a two bedroom suite!

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: arneg
Reviews.Content: Excellent pricing. Amazing room and gorgeous bed. I had to phone back and find out where they buy the pillows from.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourite hotels”
Reviews.Author: Warwicktraveller29
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed here on 3 occasions, most recently in June 2011. It is centrally situated and well managed. The rooms are well appointed and well maintained with good soundproofing. The quality of food at breakfast is very good although the continental buffet is no longer available. It is a pleasant change from the impersonal chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss Wedgewood's Bacchus Lounge for cocktails, breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryExplorer
Reviews.Content: Drinks and a unique choice of free canapes near the fireplace in the Wedgeood's Bacchus Lounge revived and enlivened us after a grueling travel day--Large 'French' windows open from Bacchus to the street opposite the Vancouver Art Gallery, great people watching. We stayed at this hotel May 12 & 13 2011, walked everywhere, returned to cookies and chocolates. Do not miss breakfast at Bacchus--incredible pastry, fruit, coffee -- delightful waitress who seemed to know many of the guests--returnees? Our room was definitely spacious, comfortable, with windows that opened to a tiny garden (I think there was a tiny balcony also). Some street noise in the morning came through open window, and room was overall darker than our room the next weekend at the nearby Hyatt, but overall lived up to its 5-star billing.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of a hotel I like better ... anywhere”
Reviews.Author: DavidMontreal
Reviews.Content: Very clean, well-appointed and comfortable guest rooms; superb staff. Nothing I could think of to improve upon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, definitely we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: genbos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Vancouver to celebrate our anniversary and stayed at the Wedgewood, the hotel was beautiful I loved the room it was absolutely gorgeous. The staff was very helpful, we got great tips on local restaurants. The bar was amazing. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeremc1
Reviews.Content: From the doormen to checkout we couldn't have asked for a better experience. The concierge, the housekeeping, the room facilities.....everything was perfect. What a friendly staff. We have travelled to many countries and within the United States, and we can honestly say that the Wedgewood tops our list of favorite places to stay. It is obvious that this hotel is well managed as reflected in all the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Always perfection”
Reviews.Author: jsbVancouver
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Wedgewood for over 20 years. We live in the area and when we want a "mini-vacation", we stay at the Wedgewood, be it for a Christmas shopping overnight or for an overnight to see a concert or show. There really is nothing to say except it is the best. They have seasonal specials during the slow times, so you might want to take advantage of these specials for your own local "mini-vacation". Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “I am already booked in again”
Reviews.Author: MARINAROSEK
Reviews.Content: I can only think of one negative for this hotel which is the size of the gym. It is tiny wee and for the size of hotel I would have thought could be double the size. One morning I couldn't even get in there. Despite this minor complaint I have already booked back in for next week. My bed is simply dreamy, the room super comfy and staff all unbelievable. Great location. Already looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully elegant. I wanted to stay forever.”
Reviews.Author: BlondchenPetit
Reviews.Content: Splendid boutique hotel in a fantastic location. I had a beautifully appointed deluxe King-bedded room with a view of Arthur Erickson"s architecture and large soaker tub ensuite, in addition to the exquisite bath with shower. The doorman is an absolute delight as are the cleaning staff, young waitress and piano player in the lounge. Extra thoughtful touches such as a welcome letter, generous array of chocolates and warm cookies personally delivered by friendly room staff add to the congenial atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly comfortable, relaxing and great service”
Reviews.Author: manofbend
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just completed a 3 day stay at The Wedgewood and felt so relaxed and pampered we hated to leave. We received a free upgrade to a two room suite which was outstanding and the staff are always very friendly and immediately responsive to any inquiry. From the Bacchus Bar downstairs to the awesome beddings in our room the experience was just splendid and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel-Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mkposhgie
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service from the entire staff! The concierge gave great suggestions on nearby places to eat and how to get to train to airport.: housekeeping was so quick to bring an extra blanket and open the sofa bed for our kids; the doormen were very friendly , and Wanda, a lovely lady who works in the Bacchus restaurant downstairs was especially kind and friendly. Breakfast was delicious. Location is close to shopping, 20 min walk to Granville Island (though we didn't get a chance to make it there) and only 5 min walk to train station. Very comfortable beds. The rooms are very clean. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel - my third stay.”
Reviews.Author: IMSMITH
Reviews.Content: I do like Relais & Chateau Hotel's and the Wedgewood truly delivers. Friendly staff, great bar and restaurant in the Bacchus not to mention lovely Suites. I must concur with all the other reviewers that give this Hotel 5 out of 5 and who will have described it in much greater detail than you need me to repeat. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful.”
Reviews.Author: MBTCLB
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at Wedgewood while attending a conference at Canada Place. The location is within easy walking distance of shopping, restaurants and just far enough from the convention center. This is a small, quiet, classy hotel with extremely polite and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: mariemtc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wedgewood Hotel and Spa over President's Day Weekend. We chose the hotel because of the reviews written and the Wedgewood Hotel and staff did not disapoint. We arrived a bit early but a suite was available and we were quickly checked in. The room was lovely and very comfortable with a large sofa/chaise combo in the living room that fit the two of us wonderfully. The bedroom had a very comfortable king bed with wonderful linens and pillows. There were little thoughtful touches such as a throw blanket, chocolates upon our arrival, bathrobes and slippers, ice bucket filled daily, nightly turn down service with cookies, etc.. Through out our stay we would find notes in our room thanking us for choosing the Wedgewood and letting us know if we needed anything from reservations at restaurants to recommendations for sight seeing to please let one of the staff know and they would arrange it for us. We did take advantage of the spa and LOVED it. We both had the exfoliation scrubs and then a 90 minute massages that were fabulous! The bar and restaurant were delightful. The bartender made great Ceasar's and the food was lovely; especially the Eggs Benedict. Additionally, the staff was wonderful. They always remembered us as we came and went and always had smiles for us and again asked us at every turn if needed anything or if they could assist us with anything. The only negative that we found was the drainage in the shower, very slow and the 4:00 am Monday morning wakeup by the trash pickup. Other than that we loved our stay and will return when we stay in Vancouver in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Still Gracious”
Reviews.Author: sandymewhinney
Reviews.Content: My first visit was in the mid-1990's - following an Alaska cruise. Last visit was in the Fall just before Winter Olympics in that city. ALWAYS delightful....comfortable rooms and congenial staff.....Looking forward to going back! Sandy S. Mewhinney, Holland and Houston, TX

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: KateWheatRidge
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the room exceeded our expectations. Staff was friendly, helpful and attentive. Hotel is perfectly situated downtown. We rented a car but didn't really need it because we could walk all over the city from the hotel. We felt perfectly at home and didn't have to say "well, we're not at home so of course we don't have it". Wifi worked perfectly every time. Bed was great, price was very reasonable for what was provided. We loved it and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: thebee888
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful days in this beautiful, stylish hotel. The room was appointed with a very comfortable sofa and wing chair and small bar at the one end. In the bedroom was an amazingly comfortable king bed with top end linens . Both living and bedroom had large windows overlooking Robson Square and both rooms featured large flat screen TVs. The big winner in this room was the gorgeous shower and separate deep bathtub, again with the high quality linens and amenities. Every person we encountered in the Wedgewood was both professional and very accommodating. Check in was a breeze and the elevators are both fast and secure. Each floor only has eight rooms, so you are never far from the elevator. Be aware that parking is by valet at additional cost but is quick and the service is as friendly as every other department in this property. We look forward to returning next spring for our thirtieth anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful!”
Reviews.Author: flroches
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only 1 night on our way back from Whistler. We had to get up at 4am, so we went to bed early. We didn't hear another guest the entire time! The hotel is in an older building, however all of the rooms are very well appointed. There was even a bar in the room. Nice views of the city from our balcony (in a standard room). Valet is the only parking option, however it is much cheaper than some of the other hotels in the same area. (I think about $18 a day). Walking distance to quite a few things. The valet attendant was very friendly and willing to help. Would love to come back and stay longer than 1 night!

Reviews.Title: “Leading Vancouver Boutique Hotel with Great Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCouple763
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wedgewood for a week in late November, 2010 and enjoyed the special rate of $199 per night including continental breakfast for two and free valet parking. There is also a further discount of 10% for longer stays. We've stayed at the Wedgewood many times over the past 5 years and always find the staff to be welcoming and accomodating. The rooms are well appointed, the bathroom is clean with everything you need and there's a small balcony where you can sit outside. The bar downstairs is lively - some nights it's difficult to find a seat! The dining room has excellent food, albeit a bit pricey. The location on Hornby near Robson is great if you want to take advantage of being in downtown Vancouver. The only minor complaint we have is that you get a bit of street noise (i.e. garbage removal, sirens) in the middle of the night - a product of being in downtown Vancouver. However, it didn't keep us up and didn't overshadow the advantages of being in downtown Vancouver. The Wedgewood is one hotel that we look forward to returning to year after year.

Reviews.Title: “simply elegant”
Reviews.Author: RayManBanga
Reviews.Content: a fantastic boutique hotel in downtown vancouver. exceptional service. a little on the expensive side. but we really liked the charm of the hotel and it is a nice weekend getaway to enjoy the delights of downtown vancouver - we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “This place was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SeriousWog
Reviews.Content: So I went to the amazing Sara Bareilles concert in Vancouver and was fortunate to find this hotel on my iPhone via Google Maps! It was my first time and I will definitively go back! First Amazing thing: They upgraded me to a king suite! The room was awesome and the bed was unbelievable! Second Amazing Thing: The room had a big jacuzzi tub... Third Amazing Thing: The bed...OMG! Sunk in and had a tremendous sleep! Fourth Amazing Thing: WIthin minutes of arriving in my room they delivered a box of edible chocolates! Fifth Amazing Thing: The hotel is within walking distance to everything!! Sixth Amazing Thing: The staff were super friendly! Seventh Amazing Thing: The hotel has a warm and inviting feel.... Wow, I'm going back!

Reviews.Title: “A special ambience, courteous and friendly staff, overall an excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: elainegordon
Reviews.Content: From the minute the valet staff greeted us we were made to feel at home. The room (one king and a separate area pullout) was immaculate with a beautiful, updated bathroom. We decided to eat at the inhouse restaurant, Bacchus, the food was delicious, the service was pleasing. Due to the piano bar being right next to the restaurant it was a tad difficult to have an easy conversation, it seemed, however, there were tables further from the bar area. The location couldn't have been better just a few steps from Robson Street. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: darthestar
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood is our hotel of choice whenever we come to Vancouver. The location is great - a five minute walk (or less) to Pacific Centre, Robson street, the Art Gallery and great restaurants. It is a gem in a busy city - always a pleasure to return to after a busy day of shopping and sightseeing. The lounge is fantastic - intimate and urban, with really good food and drink. The rooms are tastefully decorated and very clean. Extra touches, such as free bottled water and cookies are appreciated. The service is consistently good at the Wedgewood. Mark, who checked us in on this last visit, was great - friendly and attentive. He recommended a great restaurant to us (Coast). We look forward to our next stay at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Icing on Top of a Great Trip in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: domotofu
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the Wedgewood right from when I walked in and was greeted by the staff. Others have said it, and I concur. The staff are incredible. They are friendly, courteous, knowledgeable and unpretentious. After I checked in, they would greet me by name. How some staff I hadn't met before knew my name was amazing. I can only assume they pay very close attention to everything and everyone around them. They are all very easy to talk to, and if they can't help or don't know the answer to your question, they will find someone who can! I interacted with most staff (front desk, valet, housekeeping, spa), and all of them were equally great. I found their location to be quite nice. It's a fairly short walk from the subway, and though its right in downtown, I found the foot traffic to be a bit less than other streets which is nice. No frantic dodging of people as you lug your gear around, or try to get your bearings straight. It's also not too far from other sights in the area so I was able to easily explore all of downtown by foot. When I was almost to Stanley Park, I was able to hop on a public bus to quickly (not more than 10 min?) return to about two blocks from the hotel. The room I had was comfortably spacious, and I enjoyed the use of the free internet as well as the balcony (and its table and chairs) for a refreshing break outside. I found the beds to be very comfortable, and the linens were luxurious. I've stayed at better hotels that didn't have as great linens. Even the towels were wonderfully luxurious. A hotelier friend said the brand of towels and linens they use are top notch. I also enjoyed the Gilchrist & Soames toiletries. The smell was not overpowering or offensive. The hair and body products cleansed well without drying me out, and the lotion was moisturizing without being oily. I was amazed over and over again by the thoughtfulness and little touches here and there. It really shows how they tried to think of every detail to make the stay impressive. Something as minor and simple as embossing the first sheet of the toilet paper with their logo. I don't find too many hotels doing this. It wowed me only because housekeeping has to take the time out every day to that, and it's got to be straight. ;) While it looks minor, I'm sure management had to consider the extra time required for housekeeping to do this, plus the cost of the embosser plus training the staff to do it right. Anyhow, I also noticed that the hallways were lightly scented with a decorative bowl of potpourri. I could swear it was refreshed daily. It certainly was not a dusty, neglected bowl that was quickly spritzed with fragrance. I was completely floored by how clean the coffee maker was. I don't drink coffee so when there is no separate kettle for water, it's a gamble whether my tea will taste vaguely of coffee. Not only was the selection of teas delicious, the hot water that came out of the coffee maker was crystal clear with no trace of coffee. There's always the possibility I was lucky and it was a new machine, but I highly doubt it. As for the spa, it's just as fantastic as the rest of the hotel. I had my travel companion get a massage there, and his experience was perfect. According to a friend in the spa business, their offerings and his experience indicate it's a quality spa. Apparently, their signature Thai massage is uncommon since it's hard to find certified masseuses for Thai massages so I was told that if it's offered, it should be tried. Well, my friend returned as a lump of goo with a priceless expression that reflected this. The staff were very professional and constantly made sure he was comfortable and informed of every step during the treatment so that there would not be any unpleasant surprises. They would also accommodate requests if you were uncomfortable about something. When booking the treatment, I must have taxed the patience of the person who spoke to me as I had no experience with spas and massage treatments before. It took me a while with a lot of questions before I fully comprehended the different options available, and what it all meant, but never once was she impatient or irritated with me. She was very very helpful in guiding me to choose the right treatment. Overall, I was thoroughly impressed with the Wedgewood. I also stayed in two other hotels in the area during my trip but Wedgewood was hands down my favorite even though the other hotels were either on par or considered better. The "better" hotel was indeed very very nice and worthy of its categorization, but I loved how the Wedgewood was warm, cozy, luxurious and friendly in a way that made it feel like home. For the money, it's well worth it. I enjoyed my stay so much, I would go back to Vancouver just to stay here again (but I'd return to Vancouver anyway since I really enjoyed the area).

Reviews.Title: “Elegant relaxation”
Reviews.Author: UKexpatNewYork
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted by an exceptionally friendly valet - this was a pattern as all of the valets we interacted with were friendly and helpful, as were the reception staff. This was useful during our stay, as the concierge seemed to have little knowledge of the city. We were upgraded to a 2 room, 2 bathroom suite on check-in and the room did, as requested, overlook the square. Unfortunately there was a lot of building work going on, so it was not an attractive or quiet view, but not the hotel's fault. The suite was large, although with a slightly awkward layout, and the ensuite had a large spa bath with a large hatch through to the bedroom so that someone in the bath could watch the bedroom TV or converse with their partner in the bedroom. Overall I would say that the hotel is very luxurious (and priced accordingly), but good value compared to some hotels we stayed in BC and AB.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with nice staff & a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Phantomcube
Reviews.Content: Well presented hotel. Rooms are clean and the staff are very friendly. Good location for downtown Vancouver. Lots of positives. Make sure you get a room at the front (overlooking Hornby St) as a room to the rear has a terrible view and the noise from the alley below starts at 5:30am. Overall, would recommend for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Down Town Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Teamars
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and well decorated each with private balconies, the staff welcoming and highly accommodating and the restaurant is excellent. Our friends who traveled with us enjoyed the spa-this hotel is well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars All the Way”
Reviews.Author: panter
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Vancouver after a two weeks in Alaska. Although wonderful, Alaska was exhausting. The Wedgewood was like an oasis. Starting with Phillip, the manager of the hotel, who would spend time outside the door or in the lobby, greeting guests, to the doorman, check-in, beds, housekeeping, rooms, views, balconies, location - everything. Vancouver is a wonderful, vibrant city and as another reviewer said: The Wedgewood is another reason to visit this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “BEST REASON TO GO TO VANCOUVER!”
Reviews.Author: sydney323
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and really enjoy a good hotel. I have begun to prefer smaller boutique hotels. The Wedgewood has recently have become a member of a very exclusive international group of hotels,most of which are very costly. The Wedge wood was less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Our Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane24104
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Wedgewood for the past 6 or 7 years when in Vancouver, the hotel having been recommended to us by a much more experienced traveller. We have always loved the Wedgewood; however, this year was a much different experience for us. The service was not as good as it has been in the past and we didn't think that the Wedgewood standards were apparent. I must give the hotel credit though, when we sent in our evaluation survey, the manager did get back to us and state that he would discuss the service issues with the staff. We are willing to give the Wedgewood one more chance, as we love the location and the decor, and before this year, the service. Keeping our fingers crossed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, can't do enough for you”
Reviews.Author: AussieinPDX
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our young children 3 & 6, I cant say enough good things about this hotel. The doorman and valets were exceptional in helping us move the kids to and from the car, and providing really good information on the city. This is a hotel that is not arrogant, just helpful and kind. I have stayed in many of the worlds best hotels and this one like most things, the staff made the difference. Will be back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Weekend with the Chicas”
Reviews.Author: mullie
Reviews.Content: Three girlfriends and I spoiled ourselves with spa services and room service during our stay! What a treat to get out of town with great friends and then get treated like royalty at Wedgewood Hotel & Spa! Can't wait til our next getaway. I may even make reservations to take my husband back for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line!”
Reviews.Author: Cassady
Reviews.Content: Elegant yet friendly. Great location in downtown. Super staff. They had the answers to our every question. Cookies and Chococolates to die for . In addition, we spent a fabulous evening in the Bacchus Restaurant celebrating our anniversary. We'd go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lives up to it's billing of Best Small Hotel in Canada”
Reviews.Author: paulyDixon
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. It is centrally located, and I can't even begin to say enough good things about the staff. Everyone in the hotel went out of their way to make our stay very enjoyable. We were made to feel very important. I can't think of the last time I stayed in a hotel and had the desk staff remember my name as we passed through the lobby. Watching the front desk staff back up the doorman when he was otherwise engaged was refreshing to watch. There was not one instance where one of the staff said or implied that one of our needs was not their job. Great stay...great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: TriggBeach
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel a definite must stay! Walking distance to Gas Town, shopping, nightlife, Stanley Park and generally a great location. The staff were great very helpful as we were travelling of a group of about 20 people. The beds were HEAVEN!! I would recommend this hotel to any one who is going to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with choosing Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: DaveFMFL
Reviews.Content: Wedgewood was exactly what we expected; great accomodations, service, and central location. Cannot think of any complaints at all. We were treated as valued guests and every request was executed without any hitches. The Wedgewood made our seven day stay in Vancouver what we had hoped it would be.

Reviews.Title: “1st class hotel”
Reviews.Author: chefsu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our trip to Canada and Alaska for just 2 nights before going on our cruise. We had a great room with balcony and hugh tub in the bedroom! The bar had a great atmosphere and the restaurant was fantastic. Staff very helpful and friendly. All round a very classy place to stay and although not cheap it was a bargin compared to our other hotel The Westin Bayshore!! The only thing missing for us was a nice outdoor terrace to relax with a glass of wine and catch some sun. Stay here and you wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: wise1021
Reviews.Content: From the moment you stand on the pavement outside the Wedgewood you are treated like royalty. The staff cannot do enough for you. We went there on our honeymoon and were upgraded to a gorgeous room with a complimentary bottle on the first night and chocolates on the second. Each night we also had fresh cookies left in the room when the staff did the turn down service :-) The room was spacious and comfortable with free wi-fi (something a lot of the hotels we stayed in did not offer). We did not eat in the restaurant but did go to the bar. Once again the service was excellent and the staff very friendly. The reception staff were also incredibly friendly and helpful when it came to ordering taxi's and suggesting things for us to do. I filled out a questionnaire about the hotel before we left and when we got back home there was a lovely letter from the hotel saying how much they appreciated the feedback. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Vancouver. We also stayed in the Pan Pacific which was nice but a lot more business like and given the choice again I would definitely choose the Wedgewood.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel and Location, shame about Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Bartonfields
Reviews.Content: OK we didn't like Vancouver, but loved this Hotel, which was the saving grace really. If shopping is your thing, this place is perfect as it's just around the corner from the main shopping street in Vancouver. The staff are very nice and attentive. The rooms are excellent, we stayed here for 2 nights before doing a Grizzly bear tour up the coast, then returned for a 3rd night before leaving Vancouver. We were upgraded on the 3rd night to a suite which was fantastic. I think Vancouver is one of those places you either love or hate, either way, this Hotel is well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location -- but pricey”
Reviews.Author: rachel6086
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a romantic weekend getaway at the Wedgewood, a small hotel in Downtown Vancouver. Our room was very nice, with a tub for two in the main bed area, a bar with a couple of stools,a separate bathroom with nice shower, and a balcony. The bed was excellent. Decor -- English. It was not super luxurious but we really liked it. A very nice bar/restaurant adjoins the lobby. We stopped for both evening cocktails and breakfasts and each time were lucky enough to snag a seat in front of the large open windows, great for people watching All service, both hotel and bar, are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have made a better choice”
Reviews.Author: NorthEastGreetings
Reviews.Content: The Good: The Wedgewood is centrally located and convenient to anywhere you want to go in Vancouver. We were able to walk to most of our destinations for the four days that we visited Vancouver. The rooms are clean, spacious and well appointed. The beds and linens were high quality and sublime. The staff were consistently professional, courteous and responsive day and night for every day of our visit. You must dine at the Bacchus restaurant - it has fabulous food and ambiance. The piano player in the evening added just the right touch - he sings great too! The not so good: Thermostat was outdated an difficult to adjust. The hotel should update them immediately. The gym is small with limited equipment but adequate for the size of the hotel. It was never crowded. We will definitely return to the Wedgewood and highly recommend it to our friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, wonderfully calm oasis”
Reviews.Author: Katryna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a jr. suite king room which had a living room and bedroom with drapery across the doorway between and a small balcony. We were on the back of the hotel so there was no view, but it was quiet. (Currently Robson Sq. across from the front of the hotel is under construction, so I doubt any "views" are great right now.) The service was excellent--understated, friendly and professional. Entire property was elegant and well maintained with top quality amenities throughout. This is a small, refined European style hotel with a quiet, reserved atmosphere decorated in muted colors and historical prints. It is centrally located in the downtown area and everything downtown is within walking distance. There are many small cafes and restaurants nearby. The hotel bar and restaurant is lovely with excellent food and cocktails (and pricey)--dark panelled wood, velvet drapes and a fireplace. We enjoyed cocktails and dessert one evening and breakfast one morning. The room included free internet; the wireless worked well, but was rather slow; the wired connection in our room worked intermittently which might be an issue if work was a prime activity.
