We were treated to cookies each evening in our room which was a nice touch. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Loody123456
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough at how much I enjoyed my stay at the Wedgewood. We (two of my girlfirends and I) stayed for a night this past weekend. I asked for early check-in which they were able to accommodate and the front desk staff was very courteous and warm. Our room was a one bedroom suite with a balcony. The suite was tastefully decorated, roomy, and very clean. The bathroom had a lovely soaker tub and separate shower, and there were robes and slippers for each of us. Anything that we required such as extra towels or champagne glasses etc. were provided right away and in a very courteous manner. Turn-down service was included and we recieved cookies and a box of chocolatesd which was such nice touch. Even the hallways had a lovely cinnamon scent in the air. Yes, it was pricey, especially the cost of drinks in the lounge, but it really was worth every penny. Also, the location of the hotel is excellent because it is walking distance to Robson Street for shopping and Granville Street for the evening entertainment. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: DWeicker
Reviews.Content: When we arrived (my 27 year old son and I) we found the valet parking available immediately. Staff were quick to gather out equipment and suitcases. Check in was a breeze...they welcomed me back again. Quick again for check-in. Room was very nice with two large beds (as planned and expected) but there were cookies and candies (unexpected) which made it a very welcoming impression. Staff asked if we needed information on where to eat, but we already had an idea of where to go. The room was quiet, on the back side of the hotel which was nice also. We had a good sleep. Despite our early checkout (5:45 am) staff had the car waiting out front and checkout took almost a minute. All in all another great stay at the Wedgewood.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: p0rt0bell0
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend getaway to Vancouver from Seattle and had a wonderful stay at the Wedgewood. It has a smaller boutique hotel feel as you walk in their quaint lobby. The hotel staff was very hospitable during our visit. Our room was quite large with a sitting area that had a large sofa and chaise attachment, desk & chair, full-length mirror, TV and coffeemaker set up. There was another TV mounted on the wall so that you could watch from your bed. Not that we used the TVs but I thought I mentioned this for those traveling with family. The bathroom was large and they had my favorite Gilchrist and Soames products in the room. The spa bathrobes and slippers provided was also nice. They even gave us complimentary toothbrushes and toothpaste when we forgot to pack them. All the rooms have a large lanai that was a great surprise. Our room was next to the elevator but the room was super quiet and we did not hear any noise through the walls. We slept soundly in our comfy bed. The bar was a nice place to enjoy a drink or high tea and the windows opened up during the sunny weather. Fun people watching from the enclosed area. They also have an award winning French restaurant “Bacchus” which we didn’t get a chance to try. Maybe next time we will stay longer and try their restaurant and day spa. The hotel location is great and is right next to Robson Street that has lots of stores for shopping. The Vancouver Art Museum and cinema theater is around the corner. Our favorite restaurant “Le Crocodile” is also one block away. You can walk over to Yaletown (about 10 minutes) and we sat outside and enjoyed a nice lunch at Yaletown Pub. Also, you can easily walk over to take a water taxi over to Granville Market which is one of our favorite places to visit. You can also walk from the hotel to the beautiful waterfront (about 10-15 minutes) and see the caldron that was lit up for the 2010 Olympic Games. Along the waterfront you have a glorious views of Stanley Park and the mountains. There is a lovely paved walkway along the marina where you can watch the seaplanes land and where the enormous cruise ships dock. After the day of exploring the city, we walked back to our hotel and found bottles of water, gourmet chocolates, and cookies in our room. What a fabulous treat! We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for wedding party and wedding events”
Reviews.Author: MomMD14
Reviews.Content: My extended family and some friends stayed in the Wedgewood over a 4 day period during the recent wedding of our daughter. While we had the wedding reception at another venue in Vancouver, we did hold the rehearsal, the rehearsal dinner and a hospitality get-together in the hotel. Our overall experience was excellent. All of our family and our guests were very pleased with their rooms, and one party was easily accommodated when they wanted to upgrade. As parents of the bride, we were given a large suite facing Robson Square with a lovely balcony, and two bathrooms. The latter was brilliant, as we hosted the bride and the four bridesmaids on the morning of the wedding in our room as they all got ready. We were treated exceptionally well by the hotel staff for our many requests (extra cookies for the bridal party while travelling around during the wedding photos, fetching things from our valet-parked car, allowing us to have some wedding photos taken in the public areas, providing space for the decoration of our little school bus which transported the bridal party, etc), who were always cheerful and accommodating. The front desk staff were more than helpful (checking flights, printing boarding passes, giving restaurant suggestions) and the doormen were cheerful even though we were constantly coming and going and requiring frequent valet service. We had the rehearsal dinner in the Library Room of Bacchus, the hotel dining room, and it was perfect. Wonderful size for 18 people, and excellent food and amazingly professional and attentive service. The rehearsal and hospitality get-together were held in the Eton/Cambridge room, and that also worked out exceptionally well. I was aided in my planning by the catering manager, Mary Timbol, and she was invaluable in helping me arrange these events from my home in another city. Once we arrived at the Wedgewood, everything was planned to a "T" and we just relaxed and let it happen. I highly recommend this hotel as a place to stay while in Vancouver, but even more so if you are planning events around a wedding. It became our home base during the weekend, and was a gem of a place. The weekend overall was magical.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: austraveller007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in May 2010 and were very impressed with the service from all staff and also for small touches such as free bottled water provided every day (3 bottles due to triple share), 3 sets of towels etc. Not always the case at other hotels. Location was excellent, close to all attractions and transport. I would recommend booking here if you manage to get one of their special rates. Also staff were extremely prompt in answering queries. I booked with the hotel directly and noticed that all my email queries and requests were answered promptly- takes a day at most for replies, which when you consider that I communicated from Aust was great service, Sheldon in particular was very pleasant. A great hotel, thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Shortsighted policy - Spa inadequate”
Reviews.Author: den4600
Reviews.Content: We booked the Wedgewood for 4 nights at $350+ per night. After the first night in Vancouver, we wanted to cancel the last night to stay overnight in Victoria. They refused to allow the cancellation even though the request was made 36 hours in advance. Their policy is 48 hour cancel notice. This ridgid adhereance to the 48 hour policy even after staying 3 nights put a negative spin on our trip. The spa is very small and cramped. My wife was told she could not enter the steam room since there were two people already in there and there was no room. Getting a spa appointment was difficult and we had to rearrange our schedule to fit into theirs. There were very limited night appointments. The excersize room can only fit 2 to 3 people at once. On the one day we were staying around the hotel the maid did not come till 4pm even though I called the front desk at 2:30 and requested the room be cleaned ASAP. The on-site restaurant/bar is nice but very expensive as are the spa treatments. The location of the Wedgewood is excellent. You are close to public transportation which is simple and frequent. Do not get exited about the balcony, it overlooks an alley. Definitly use the Skytrain from the airport to downtown, it is no problem even with luggage. Overall, for the price, there are many alternatives in downtown Vancouver which would provide a better experience than the Wedgewood.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but beware of construction across the street”
Reviews.Author: finickytraveller2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into the hotel late in the evening. We were given a lovely suite, very well appointed on the 8th floor of the front side of the hotel and settled in for a 4 night stay. The first morning was quiet and we enjoyed our day in Vancouver. The hotel is near a nice market, movie theater, Robson street shopping and plenty of good restaurants. Unfortunately, the second morning, I awoke at 7am due to jackhammer noise along with the beep beep beep that construction equipment makes when backing up and general construction noise. There is a large construction project across the street from the hotel so be aware of that. When asked if we could move to something quieter, we were told they get complaints about garbage trucks coming at 5am at the back of the hotel but they would show us another room higher up on the front side. We tried the 11th floor, but the noise was not any better so checked out and went to another hotel down the street. To their credit, they did not penalize us for checking out early due to the problem with the noise. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are very nice, but I do wish they had told us about the construction. I would recommend this hotel to anyone once construction is complete so check first. My ratings of value and sleep quality are due entirely on the basis of the construction noise, otherwise they would have been higher.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel staff I've ever encountered!”
Reviews.Author: shanhoward
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Vancouver with four girlfriends and we stayed in a one-bedroom suite at the Wedgewood. They had the nicest hotel staff I have ever experienced! The concierge gave us several good restaurant recommendations (Brix in Yaletown, Go Fish - Granville Island) and made reservations for us. Every time we went to ask the staff anything they seemed to know what we needed before we even asked and had an answer or solution ready. The room was ready for us early when we arrived and after our stay, they let us keep our car at the hotel after we checked out so that we could do extra site-seeing and shopping. The room was exactly as promised, comfortable beds, huge shower, etc. Also, a perfect central location in downtown Vancouver - we walked everywhere. I will stay here again next time I'm in the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: anamariasofia
Reviews.Content: Luxury in Downtown Vancouver. Close to all amenities, without the hassle of the noise. The best restaurant around. Their Spa is one of the best in the city.

Reviews.Title: “the best place to stay in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sunshinefun_10
Reviews.Content: We don't often get to stay in a hotel, and we are picky about where we stay, because of chemical allergies--but we got a good deal at the Wedgewood, and it was great. I love that they have hypoallergenic sheets and bedding. At some hotels you can smell the bleach in the towels, but not here thankfully. Everything about the hotel is well kept and it has a very boutique character, and it was nice to have the soaker tub outside of the bathroom. And of course the spa, restaurant and location also made the stay better. We've stayed twice in the past couple years, and definitely want to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: pdx2006
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled upon entering the gorgeous Wedgewood Hotel and Spa. I trust the Relais & Chateux brand, and it lived up to its luxurious standard. The room was large and included a terrace the length of the apartment-like suite. Comfortable amenities abounded, including full living room furniture, DVD players for the flat-screen televisions, large marble bathrooms, and delightful turndown service complete with cookies and spring water. Bacchus lounge and restaurant in the hotel's lobby was a fabulous place to enjoy a martini next to a roaring fire. Service was impeccable, and the location ideal. I'd absolutely go back to the Wedgewood.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: petejoyNewPlymouth
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood Hotel& Spa, was the best we stayed at on our recent around the world holiday. The rooms were simply superb.Large &airy& quiet. The service was of the highest quality,the dinning facilities were excellent. The hotel is well situated,& is easily reached from the airport. It is centraly placed& ideal for walking to all venues. The staff were all friendly& cooperative.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Great value for 5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: PondiRoad
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to explore Vancouver. Comfortable bed. Very friendly and helpful staff--from the bellman who gave me area recommendations to the bartender. Unbelievably fun bar. Great restaurant--had several meals there and was never disappointed. I have stayed at the Four Seasons in Vancouver--which is also great BUT at this price point Wedgewood is the best bet. I am hooked!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: Diz01
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood is in a grat l;ocation in downtown Vancouver. There are lots of restaurants close by and Robson Street is just round the corner. We arrived by car and our luggage was whisked away and car parked (pretty reasonable rate - c$14 from memory overnight) wit no fuss. We checked quickly and were upgraded to a suite which was great news. This put us on one of the upper floors. The room was a good size for city centre with a very comfortable large bed. Plenty of storage and a separate room with chairs etc. The bathrom was surprisingly small and felt cramped. The bath was not large and the sink was jammed in by the door. The shower cubicle was large but the water pressure disappointing. The room felt a bit dark. The decoration was also a little dark giving it a bit of an old fashioned feel. Personal taste maybe. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. We had great help from the concierge with restaurant reservations. We didn't use the hotel restaurant. Overall a good city centre hotel but would prefer something a bit more sylish in a city like Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: elliepoppy
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days here after returning from a cruise. Wonderfully located with very helpful staff. Suite was a good size, beautifully clean with nice touches like cookies left by the bed to have with a coffee from the coffee machine in the room. Only complaint was rooms were made up far too late, often coming back to the room for a rest with room not having been made up. Didn't eat in the restaurant as we were out and about most days, but it looked very elegant.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was one of our favorites, ever.”
Reviews.Author: Riverhorse0
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised by the Wedgewood Hotel. We visited Vancouver during all-time-record-breaking heat and the Wedgewood was like a sanctuary in the middle of the hot city. Every time we came back to the room we were able to slip between the cold sheets and refresh and rejuvenate. Within 30 minutes of checking in, everyone on the staff knew our names and they went out of their way to make our stay just wonderful. The restaurant is just delicious and the room (we had a suite) was just right, luxurious and elegant, without being over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: sandnsun61
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Wedgewood in a Deluxe Executive King under the 25 Anniversary Promotion. We received 25% off the room plus 25% off all meals in Bacchus. We ate breakfast everyday at the hotel and had one dinner at Bacchus as well. The staff accomodated every request and were very pleasant. We were addressed by name most of the time. During our stay on Saturday, the entire street in front of the hotel (Hornby) was closed for a city block due to a large crane loading glass into a building across the street. The hotel was very apologetic about the situation, but it had little bearing on anything other than trying to get a cab. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely romantic...”
Reviews.Author: RCane
Reviews.Content: I proposed to my wife in the Bacchus Lounge two years ago, during a short trip to Vancouver. I'd been waiting for the right moment, and after three days staying at the Wedgewood while sightseeing around Vancouver, we were both in the perfect mood. This hotel was amazing and would be one of our favorites - even if we weren't so biased!

Reviews.Title: “Deferential and knowledgeable service”
Reviews.Author: lostinthewash
Reviews.Content: I'm not a worldwide traveller but have been to enough hotels to know over-the-top customer service when I experience it. The hotel clearly embodies a culture of "the customer comes first" from the front desk staff to the cleaning staff. They treated me with that slight amount of respectful deference - enough to feel that I was the only customer they had to deal with today, and I was the MOSt important person in the hotel, but not crossing the line to condescending. It's a skill not seen in many hotels. I had a Deluxe King room - truly delightful with a fabulous corner soaker tub and really, really comfortable bed. The location is everything you'd want in Vancouver. I'm told by the locals that the bar/lounge is THE number one spot in Vancouver - if that is true, the staff have not let that affect their service or attitude. They made me feel like my business mattered and that it was important that I, personally, come back.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular room, first class service.”
Reviews.Author: jmford
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, I felt well taken care of from start to finish. From the box of chocolates on the first night to the fresh baked cookies and bottle of water nightly. The rooms were gorgeous with very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SheehanDublin
Reviews.Content: Am just finishing up a fabulous stay at the Wedgewood. We have travelled to all corners of the planet and I can honestly say our stay at the Wedgewood has been a pure pleasure. The staff are wonderful and the location of the hotel is smack in the middle of downtown, right beside prime shopping areas and within walking distance of everything. The rooms are very well appointed. Our bed was large and delciously comfortable which was very important after a transatlantic flight and serious jet lag. The restaurant downstairs has a wonderful ambience, great food and staff that are friendly and efficient. This hotel has a wonderful balance between luxury and hominess. They run a superbly efficient business while managing to maintain a local almost family feel. I really cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Most efficient and friendliest service ever”
Reviews.Author: ileanafourie
Reviews.Content: The most efficient and friendliest service that I have ever received. Great food, even room service was superior. A boutique hotel that is exceptional in every way. I will never stay anywhere else in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLover74
Reviews.Content: Our room (deluxe suite) was large and tastefully decorated with excellent facilities such as 2 x plasma tv's, a huge amount of wardrobe and drawer space and a marble bathroom with a vast walk in shower. The Bacchus lounge was a great way to wind down for the day and has an extensive bar that should suit all tastes and budgets. The staff were all friendly, efficient and eager to help. This hotel is definitely on a par with some of the best in the world and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing !”
Reviews.Author: tshopper
Reviews.Content: Right from check in I was made to feel welcome and taken care of. All of the staff were very friendly, polite and the attention to detail was unbelievable. My weekend away was fabulous, thanks to the Wedgewood Hotel. Highly recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious stay”
Reviews.Author: ij_gallagher
Reviews.Content: We booked this a few days before travelling and managed to get a very good rate on a deluxe suit. The room was incredible and had a balcony overlooking Robson Square - request this side of the hotel if possible. The service was particularly good and personalised, the mark of a real boutique hotel. After a long transatlantic flight I had a massage in the spa that helped with a stiff back considerably! This really was a special place to stay and as good a city hotel as I've stayed in - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless service & exceptional food”
Reviews.Author: parlow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wedgewood hotel for 4 nights and I have to say that from start to finish the service was exceptional. Not all smaller hotels manage to get service 100% right, while larger hotels tend to be impersonal. The Wedgewood manages to be both friendly and exceptionally professional. From arranging a car to pick up at the airport, to pre-booking a spa day, to ad hoc advice on what to do in Vancouver the hotel staff couldn't be faulted. Not cheep but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Our once in a life time holiday”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Canada_Visitor
Reviews.Content: Based in the centre of Vancouver with the harbour 7 blocks to the left and the beach 7 blocks to the right of the main entrance. A perfect central location for exploring Vancouver. A very plush hotel. Specious elegant rooms. Excellent service. The staff were very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect end to a long but wonderful day”
Reviews.Author: PinkGypsy
Reviews.Content: Weddings are known for their extremely rich time commitment and our wedding was no different! With both of us sharing Punjabi ancestry and a Sikh spiritual background, we had multiple opportunities to celebrate with our loved ones. Planning for all of these events was no small feat! But celebrating was a ton of fun! The day of the wedding, we were both up super early (as the Bride, I was up by 4:30 am to be ready for 8:00 am and my fabulous groom was up around 6:00 am), after pre-wedding photos, we headed to the Gurduara (Akali Singh Sikh Temple, Vancouver, BC), and really appreciated the very sacred ceremony that has connected us on multiple levels. After the post wedding pictures and some post wedding festivities, we headed to the Wedgewood Hotel. We were greeted promptly by the valet, who was very welcoming. We headed into the lobby and were greeted by the front desk clerk who quickly checked us in and confirmed our dinner reservation. We were extremely impressed by the prompt, friendly and welcoming service. We then, placed our belongings in our room and headed down for dinner. We had the roasted chicken dinner for 2 (a Sunday night tradition at the Wedgewood and hopefully an anniversary tradition for us!) and it was amazing! The service was incredible (again!) and every aspect of our dining experience was perfect. Our attentive server congratulated us on our wedding and brought out a wonderful dessert plate for us to enjoy. The table next to us were celebrating a wedding anniversary and asked if they could send over a bottle of champagne. Although, we graciously declined, it continued to highlight the coziness of this wonderful hotel. We then left for a walk (as Vancouverites, we know the city well but would never think to spend a night at a hotel - this was a total treat) and returned to our very comfortable and quiet room. As we had been up so early and were scheduled for a family lunch the next day, we soon melted into the king size bed. The next morning, we got ready and headed down for breakfast. Again, the service and the food was perfect! The manager at one point noticed that I had slipped my shawl over my shoulders and promptly but on the heat - and came over to tell me the room would be warming up soon. Many organizations strive to excel when it comes to customer service and have a very challenging time with this art form ... that may sound a bit over the top but with the decline of customer service, I have to argue that providing excellent customer service has become an art form. The Wedgewood Hotel has this art-form mastered. To attend to the subtle nuances - seeing a guest put a shawl on and responding to that prior to any mention of it - illustrates how this art form is embraced by the Wedgewood team. Thank you for helping us wrap up our wedding day in a perfect atmosphere with perfect touches ... it was the perfect end to our amazing wedding day!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy European Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Steph2727
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed for 2 nights in May prior to our cruise from Anchorage. I had seen the interior of the hotel about 15 years ago but did not stay there. As we had been to Vancouver a couple times before we debated as to whether we should stay near the waterfront or to stay at the Wedgewood for the lovely boutique ambiance. I am so glad we chose the Wedgewood! We got a great rate (shoulder season). The double beds were very comfortable and the room was large and nicely appointed. Loved the duvet and the complimentary chocolates. The bathroom was gorgeous. We had a little balcony and it was nice to be able to open the door for fresh air. Had a fabulous meal in the Bacchus lounge. My mother wanted to eat there again on the second night but I had made a reservation at Chambar. While the food at Chambar was good I think the food at Bacchus was better and definitely more relaxing. The hotel location was perfect and we could walk everywhere. We visited the new Shangri-La to check out the boutique (very tiny). We didn't see a room there but I assume they are very nice. Shangri-la seems like one of the large Las Vegas hotels where you enter thru the underground parking area. We were very happy to be returning to the Wedgewood. The front desk staff were very professional. Had one of them accompany me to the business center as the computer wasn't allowing me to log in. The Wedgewood deserves its membership in the Relais Chateaux hotel group. The Wedgewood is a delightful elegant boutique hotel with a cozy European ambiance that we will look forward to staying at again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply delightful”
Reviews.Author: barryfox
Reviews.Content: Briliant hotel, perfect location, fantastic staff and great ambience

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: JHarris_9
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we walked in to the Wedgewood it was a fantastic experience. The valet was efficient and we were checked in very speedily. The room was lovely, clean and well furnished. The bathroom was great. No detail was too small, down to the nice toiletries and great quality coffee. In the evening, there was water and cookies and a turn down service. Dinner in Bacchus was a treat, the food was excellent with a relaxed ambience. Our stay included the continental breakfast which was nice. Looks like they have a pretty good gym and the spa looks lovely. The location is great and near to the heart of Vancouver with all its attractions and good shopping. The courtesy, professionalism and warmth exuded by all the staff was exemplary...loved the total attention to detail. Will certainly be coming back again...very, very highly recommended. Congratulations to the staff at the Wedgewood...awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves All The Accolades”
Reviews.Author: Canoodle
Reviews.Content: Often described as Vancouver's premier boutique hotel by people in the know,my wife and I set off for the Wedgewood from our home ,about 5 km's away.You see,my wife had won a gift certificate for the Wedgewood and we eagerly awaited our 1 night stay. From the moment we stopped at the front door and the valet promptly whisked my car away to sleep for the night,we could tell we were in for a treat. On entering the lobby ,you are greeted by an aromatic smell ,on the day ,a combination of flowers and cinnamon,which permeated the hotel-even as far as the 11th floor where we stayed. The room ( a Deluxe 1 bed suite) was immaculate,complete with complimentary box of chocolates and welcoming letters from both the owner of the establishment as well as GM.Really unbelievable attention to detail ,which is often sorely lacking,even in top class hotels. We decided to immediately go out and explore Robson Street-even though we live pretty close by-this was probably the first time in 3 years both my wife and I had been there. Plenty of restaurants at your doorstep,running the gamut from Indian to Vietnamese and everything else inbetween. On returning to the room about 2 hours later-we found the bed had been made !! We had ruffled the duvet slightly when testing the mattress on entering initially. Next morning we made our way down to the Bachus Restaurant for breakfast-which was satisfactory-not to be ungrateful or anything but a little disappointing-the obligatory cereals,eggs,toast etc. All things considered this is really an excellent hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but LOVED it for a romantic night!”
Reviews.Author: SuperSC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our wedding night after having our intimate reception dinner in Bacchus restaurant (part of Wedgewood Hotel). It's a beautiful hotel but I still feel as though it's overpriced. I paid about $350 or $400 (can't quite remember now as it was 8 months ago) for the one night and I thought because I was spending about $1500 having my wedding dinner at Bacchus and it was my wedding night they would have given me a discount but they didn't. I was able to negotiate a late check-out (2pm, not that great) and they gave us a bottle of sparkling wine but that's about it. The room was beautiful with a jacuzzi tub and a nice big bed but, the more I think about it, it still wasn't worth the price necessarily. The hotel is definitely clean and definitely in a nice area. I would say this hotel is a great place to stay for a splurge - wedding night, anniversary, one night of a longer trip but I can't imagine it would be worth the $300 or more a night to stay here for a full week. Other fancy hotels would have more amenities and maybe a kitchenette in the room or something.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sonia100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wedgewood for 5 nights in January 2009 and loved it! The beds are amazing, the staff is really attentive (they remembered what we ordered for breakfast), and the location is perfect (right next to all the shopping etc). The stars love it too. On the last day we were there, Goldie Hawn was at the table next to us at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “a slice of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: lindymac85
Reviews.Content: From the time that we arrived to the time that we left, the hotel amazed us. The staff was friendly, professional and helpful. The room was so clean that it made for an enjoyable stay. I for one hate rooms that are not classy and this one certainly was. I had the best sleep and the carved chicken dinner was to die for; not only the quality but the ambience. My family and I will certainly stay there again and recommend the hotel HIGHLY!!!

Reviews.Title: “love the quirky wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: aliceinnyland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I walked into the Wedgewood after leaving the hotel we had booked (the Opus, which was horrible). We were at the end of a long business travel swing, and wanted somewhere that would work for us both for business and for relaxing. The Wedgewood is definitely quirky--the decor is so dated it's new again (high late-sixties-to-early-seventies), the gym teeny, the bar so retro it's got a piano guy. I had seen pictures of the rooms online, and had my doubts about the in-room tubs. but the rooms were spotless, the service excellent, the location great. prices weren't bad, either. we booked a suite; it's been perfect, comfortable and cozy and spacious and very very very quiet and well-maintained. Staff members are friendly and professional, too. The phone lines are a bit crackly, and there's no ipod docking station (though there are flat-screen tvs) but there's a lot of thoughtfulness and comfort here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: EmilyPankhurst
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here on a recommendation from a friend in 2006 and I was not disappointed. Have returned in April 2008. This hotel is small in comparison to other 5* rated and in my opinion gives a more personal touch with attention to detail. Centrally located for downtown shopping. The rooms are very comfortable with a t.v in both your sitting room and bedroom with a good selection of recent released movies. Room service is prompt & the food is excellent arriving hot with a silver service presentation. I will certainly be staying in the Wedgewood again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a Night at the Wedgewood!”
Reviews.Author: debrouillard
Reviews.Content: This past weekend finally had the opportunity to stay at the Wedgewood, home of our favourite restaurant and lounge. We received a very appealing email offer from the Wedgewood called "Friends of the Wedgewood" and decided to head off downtown for a lovely relaxing night away in our own city.The promotion included breakfast and a discount in their quaint spa which we eagerly booked before arriving. An afternoon steam and then we opted for a light dinner in the lounge with some great cheeses and an excellent Bordeaux. Service, food and ambiance all first class as you would expect at a Relais & Chateaux property. Upon check out we booked again for a little pre Christmas shopping getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ergodic
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful botique hotel located centrally in downtown Vancouver. If you're looking for an alternative to larger and so inevitably more impersonal luxury hotels such as the Fairmonts, this is probably one for you. Service was attentive, if not entirely world-class. Our suite was gorgeously appointed; perhaps a little small for what I'd expect at the price. Parking is a bit of a problem and the (manditory) valet can take a while - just remember to call down well in advance. I don't want these comments to turn anyone away, these are mostly minor issues. Also, they seem to have a habit of trying to steer you to their in-house restaurant. Which is very good, fairly expensive, and a little stuffy. Our advice is to skip that and wander a few blocks down closer to the water and find your way to one of Vancouver's many excellent dining & music establishments. It is in a downtown area so of course it is a bit noisy - especially sitting on the veranda. But neither myself nor my wife found it to be an issue and I'm sensitive to that kind of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynda55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 3 nights at the Wedgewod hotel in Vancouver. It was pure luxury in the executive king suite with balcony. It even had a bar in the room with bar stools. The facilities were exceptional including a giant size soak tub for 2. Comfortable, clean, great service, excellent lounge bar for cocktails and good restaurant. My only comment is that the restaurant is quite formal but do go at least once - the food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: cervenk
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. My husband and I stayed at the Wedgewood for four nights while on vacation in June 2007. We had a lovely stay, and everyone on staff was wonderful. The rooms were elegantly appointed and comfortable, the bar has to be one of the best hotel bars in North America, and the location near Robson Street is excellent. Great attention to every detail. I have to single out the folks in the kitchen at Bacchus, however, for they truly went the extra mile for us. During our first full day in Vancouver we pulled up several tasty-looking Dungeness crabs while salmon fishing near the Fraser River. Lee Parsons and his talented sous chef graciously agreed to prepare some of the crabs for us for dinner that night, and what a feast! The tarragon beurre blanc was divine, and the accompaniments were perfect. It will easily be one of the more memorable meals my husband and I have had together. If you want an extra-indulgent stay in Vancouver, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NoLeakHere
Reviews.Content: This was a brillient hotel and a highlight at the end of the 3 week tour of western Canada. The staff were so friendly, everyone appeared to know our name. The doorman would always see us approaching and open the door welcoming us by name. We were only there for one night and dined at the Bacchus restaurant in the hotel. Again superb food and excellent waiter who was extremely knowledgeable about the local wines. As we left the hotel the doorman and the doorman was finding us a taxi the the hotel receptionist came out (in plain clothes for his afternoon off) who stopped and again addressed us by name and enquired about out holiday and plans. The room we had was in the centre of the front on floor 4 with a great balcony. There was a large bath in the room and a superb shower in the bathroom. I can wholehartedly recommend this hotel. It is quite expensive but we feel it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing checkout problem”
Reviews.Author: Scottieman5
Reviews.Content: My business associate and I had booked two of the better rooms at the weekend with breakfast rate. On checking out and reviewing our bills, we were both charged a much higher rate and also for breakast. The management was most uncooperative in resolving the issues even though we both had in hand printed confirmations stating the rates that we were guaranteed. i had to dispute my charges through American Express Platinum Program to get a settlement. Tthe gym area is tiny and the business area had only one computer that was operating but you could not print from it. The rooms were nice but small with a soaking tub in the bedroom. After this experience, I cancelled future reservations that we had for August, October, and December and rebooked at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The Best - My Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettyh
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I've ever stayed in. Loved the Wedgewood. We arrived at 9:15am from a cruise and our son was not feeling well. We knew check-in was at 3pm so were expecting them to hold our luggage. We were greeted with big smiles and told our rooms would be ready in 10 minutes!! Because it was our anniversary they upgraded my husband and myself but made sure our other family members were just across the hall. The rooms are beautiful, the beds divine, our balcony had a lovely view of the art museum and Fairmont hotel, the Hop-On-Hop-Off bus is just a block away, and staff is so helpful and always smiling. The flowers in the reception area and halls are all fresh and lovely. That evening we were tired and in jeans and only wanted a bite to eat. We knew Bacchus, their restaurant, was top of the line so we asked the desk where we might walk to for a light dinner. They encouraged us to go into the Wedgewood Lounge. It was perfect. A piano player, wonderful drinks and an excellent light menu. There was a mixed group but no one seemed to mind that we were in jeans. It is a popular after the theater spot to eat. Check out was a breeze and they were very upset when we came down with our luggage - that is their job to see to your every need. Don't miss this place. We booked through the Vancouver Tourism website and with a VISA special the rooms were very resonable, much less than Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Wedgewood duing our 5 day visit to Vancouver. We loved the hotel. The service was impeccable; the staff was warmly and genuinely helpful in every way. The rooms were first rate and the location could not be better.We would not hesitate to recommend the Wedgewood to any friend planning to visit Vancouvewr

Reviews.Title: “Noisy area”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveling22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very noisy area - a hospital is close by and I believe a fire station. We heard sirens until midnight, then fell asleep. At 7 am, there was street construction noise. Besides that, the rooms were nice. I'd recommend the better suites to the minimal one bc it only has a drape to separate the rooms and the bathroom is in the sitting room (doesn't work well with kids). Also, the bedroom was small as was the sitting room. The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: dogymom
Reviews.Content: I guess my standards must be a lot higher than most people who have stayed at the Wedgewood. Yes, it has a great location (close to shopping and restaurants); nice inviting entry and reception area; nice restaurant; Frette linens; and a comfortable bed. BUT the room was hot and stuffy because the air conditioning did not work properly; room looked old and tired; noise from doors slamming in the hallways was loud and would always wake me; and floors were always squeeking when walking around. When I told this to the staff (a lady) at check-out, she told me that next time I should ask for a different room with a better view. I told her that I didn't care about a view and didn't she understand what I just said? Anyway, will not spend my hard earned money there again. Will stay at the Four Seasons which is always a safe bet. Yolanda

Reviews.Title: “A touch of luxury”
Reviews.Author: noddyandbigears
Reviews.Content: For our last night in Vancouver, we stayed in this hotel and what a good choice it proved to be. As soon as our taxi drew up our doors were opened and luggage taken into the lobby. The staff were very welcoming. Our room was spacious, the bathroom looked new and thick robes to use once you had showered. A box of chocolates greeted us on arrival and staff were prompt in bringing some decaffeinated coffee to our room. At bedtime there were cookies. The sheets were a good quality cotton and made for a good nights sleep. The business centre was well equipped and there was also a steam room. We had breakfast and enjoyed the freshly baked croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Magic on the Pacific..”
Reviews.Author: flatworm
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel! Brilliant location, slick but friendly service , lovely room and excellent breakfast Free chocs on arrival, turndown service..and Van is a magic city!

Reviews.Title: “I want to live at the Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: MangoTravels
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Wedgewood, and was almost sad to leave the hotel. The bed was beautiful, big, and so comfortable. The room and the bathroom were roomy. The toiletries are wonderfully scented. I'd read all about the welcome box of truffles and the nightly cookies and water along with turndown service, but it still felt like a special treat. The location was ideal, truly in the heart of a great and very walk-able downtown. We had a great view from a 10th floor room. I must say that we don't generally stay at places that are this highly rated, so my expectations maybe aren't as high as people who frequently stay at places like this. We got such a GREAT rate as part of their winter discounts, that we almost felt guilty about it :) The staff was personable and very helpful the couple of times we needed directions, or help making reservations (but again we weren't very demanding people). One major thing I noted is that we very rarely heard other guests while in our room. We could hear a door close every now and then, but other than that it felt like we had the entire floor to ourselves. It was a nice surprise because often we feel like a lot of hotels have paper-thin walls. Oh if you stay here, do yourself a favor and book a dinner at the Bacchus restaurant (part of the hotel). It's an expensive restaurant but it is worth every penny. Superb service and even better food. Overall, a great experience and we hope they will run more off-season deals so that we have the opportunity to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: wdp21
Reviews.Content: the wedgewood is a great option and value. it is centrally located -- you can walk to the seabus -- and the rooms that overlook the law library park have a very good view. we had a suite with an inroom soaking tub which was awesome. we ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and enjoyed the live music even more than the food which was superb! the musician/singer will dedicate a song for you and keep you entertained.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: IdahoCoug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on a quick getaway. Had a jacuzzi suite, what a wonderful room. Easy walk to Robson. Valet's were quick when we wanted to drive somewhere and gave easy to follow directions. Food was wonderful. This is the place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: vacationtimeCa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wedgewood after spending a weekend in Whistler and immediately wished we had more than just one night in town. Wedgewood is a charming boutique hotel in a nice area of Vancouver. There were so many extras, from the sunken tub, turn down service, fresh cookies and chocolates. Our room had a great portable map for suggested walks/runs and we took the four mile loop through Stanley park, which was great. We really felt like the staff was looking out for us. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic & food to die for”
Reviews.Author: LilyLarkin
Reviews.Content: I loved, loved, loved this hotel - especially the most wonderful breakfast and lunch in the very upmarket restaurant within the hotel. The food is absolutely to die for here. We had a fabulous suite when we stayed, and even the handmade (yes, handmade!) biscuits in the room were incredibly delectable. Every detail is just perfect - the Wedgewood is quirky, lavish, lush and just one of the most gorgeous places to rest your head in Vancouver. Of course, the hotel is also fabulously located within easy reach of anywhere you need to be in this exceptional city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegal15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this delightful hotel for 3 nights in September, 2006 just before boarding our cruise ship. It is in a wonderful position, close to all the shops and we were given a lovely front room. We had a weekend package with bed and breakfast which we felt was good value. The only downside was that we ate in their Bacchus Restaurant one night and we felt the meal was rushed. We were out within 45 minutes which to us was far too rapid. We do like to linger over a meal especially when we are paying top dollar. That is our only criticism of a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiul hotel, efficient staff and well located too”
Reviews.Author: kingsdown
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood staff made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived and made us feel that nothing was too much trouble. They continued to look after our every need with efficiency we had not experienced elsewhere in Canada for the duration of our short stay. The rooms were large and very comfortable, the staff knowledgable and friendly and the food was some of the best we ate on our three week trip; this was made more enjoyable by the eagerness of the restaurant staff to adapt meals to suit dietary requirements / whims! I couldn't recommend the Wedgewood highly enough as a very luxorious and comfortable base to explore Vancouver from whether it is for business or pleasure. If i return to Vancouver I will definitely be giving the Wedgewood a call!

Reviews.Title: “A most fabulous 30th anniversary stay . . .”
Reviews.Author: ShadowfaxVienna_VA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wedgewood Aug 18-22 celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. I was a little nervous, given the couple of less-than-wonderful reviews I read on trip advisor. For those of you questioning whether or not to go, I must say: DO NOT HESITATE booking at the Wedgewood! I simply cannot say enough wonderful things about the Wedgewood and the amazing staff. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the friendliest doorman (Martin) who made a great first impression. He was always quick to retrieve our car, hold the door open for us, or hail a cab for us. The staff at the Reception Desk wereALWAYS cheerful and helpful, and especially our dear Gillian, who helped us numerous times, always with a smile. Our Deluxe Executive Room room was terrific -- loved the bed (comfy with great linens) and absolutely perfect pillows. TV was large and easy to see from bed and was housed in a lovely armoire. The TV was also visible from the in-room tub (which was great fun and was CLEAN). I adored the marble bathroom and magnificent shower, which was made of tumbled marble tile -- just lovely! Frette towels were divine. Dinner at Bacchus (the on-site restaurant) was just amazing ... great food (try the mussel soup!), warm, romantic ambiance. We had drinks in the lounge one night and were so comfortable that we stayed for dinner. On the day of our 30th anniversary, we treated ourselves to massages in the Spa, and what a delight!!!! If you want to stay in a hotel that makes you feel pampered in every way, go to the Wedgewood. As I said, I was a little nervous, but if you are appreciative of fine antiques, lovely Oriental carpets and other special pieces, you will love this place ... very "upscale European" feel to it, although the rooms are certainly larger than any you will find in Europe! I searched for MONTHS AND MONTHS for a place to go to celebrate our 30th, and I was not disappointed. The biggest compliment to the Wedgewood was my husband's reaction -- he was thrilled with the place, and did not want to leave. I simply cannot imagine how someone would think the place is "worn" or "tired" -- a competitor writing a review, perhaps? I am only writing this review to assure potential customers that they WILL NOT be disappointed if they stay at the Wedgewood. I only dream that one day I can go back .. .

Reviews.Title: “Top choice!”
Reviews.Author: Ratbag
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant 5 night stay at the start of our holiday in Canada. The staff were polite, courteous and knowledgeable. Check-in and valet parking were swift and efficient, and the room (304) was large, with the bath in the main room, and a separate large shower and bathroom. Toiletries and towels were plentiful and kept well stocked, and the bed was really comfortable. The room was clean and tidy, and the turndown cookies were divine! It was a nice touch as well to have a welcome box of chocolates with a hand-written note from the owner. The gym is tiny, and you would be advised to get there by 0800 to avoid waiting for a turn, but this was OK for us as we were not yet keyed into the 8 hr time difference. The hotel was able to book excellent restaurants for us, give hints as to what was good, shopping places, book ferry tickets etc. We ate breakfast there once (excellent) and dinner once (very very good). There are lots of other places to eat round town within 5-30 minutes walking distance. Cin Cin was good, but C was a really good meal, sitting outside overlooking Granville Island and watching the sun go down. Very memorable. It was great that the staff remembered us when we were back for 1 night a week later after our return from Vancouver Island. Little things like this make this hotel truly memorable. If we go to Vancouver again, we would not even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Wedgewood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KDSVictoria
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel almost every time I have been to Vancouver since 1988, (the other Hotels pale in comparison). I find the service excellent, the restaurant and lounge are delightful and the rooms are beautifully presented, with the linens being crisp white, and the TV hidden in an Armoire. I usually stay in an executive room or a small suite, and find them both comfortable and very functional. I stay in many hotels world wide and this one is superior for it's price range. The hotel goes out of it's way to make the stay as pleasant as they can, from the chocolates upon arrival, the turn down service, with water and biscuits in the evening, to the friendly staff. I even had the misfortune to be quite ill once when staying there, and I was checked on during the day, water left at my door as not to disturb me, and the concierge went to my vehicle to get me pain medication - outstanding. The location is excellent, right by the Art Gallery, shopping on Robson Street, along with several great restaurants in all price ranges. It is a short walk down to Stanley Park, and as a tourist visiting the City for the 1st time, I could not think of a better location or Hotel to stay in. Ask for a room over the Court Rooms, for a view of City Life.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: Ruffy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Wedgewood. I love old-world, boutique hotels. The Wedgewood's lobby and restaurant were beautiful and lived up to my expectations. Also, the location is great. However, my room was dated and tired. Until the hotel refurbishes its rooms, I would choose to stay at another hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Ralff
Reviews.Content: Tired and overpriced. We had a mid floor “suite.” Suite is a misnomer. The room was old and tired. The tv in the bedroom was bolted to the ceiling. The tv in the sitting area, was a beat-up old RCA. The bedroom part of the “suite” was cramped. Rather than a door separating the rooms, there was a stained thick tapestry/window curtain. The furniture was old and tired. The walls were dreary, dank and simply depressing. Service was not up to par for the price. The recommendation for a dinner was awful – don’t rely on the concierge. Overall DEFINITLEY NOT at all worth the price charged. Also, the garbage trucks that frequent the ally are loud. Look elsewhere. Something good – the chocolates that they leave for you are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: nature+surf
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Wedgewood in June, on the way to and from an Alaskan cruise. The hotel was beautiful and charming, and we really enjoyed our stay. We had an adjoining room for the kids- they slept on the pull-out couch. We did request an extra cot since the kids are teenagers and didn't relish sharing a bed, but there were not any cots or roll-away beds. The kids especially loved the turn down service with the cookies. The location of the hotel is excellent, we were able to access many activities easily. We had one breakfast and one dinner at the hotel's restaurant. The food was very good, presented well and the price was expensive but fair. We thought the decor of the room was very nice, comfortable and inviting. The front desk staff was generally great- although there was one woman that was exceptionally helpful, going out of her way to help us with all of our requests (even one request of finding a store to get a broken watch repaired was fulfilled within minutes). There was another woman that worked at the front desk who was a bit aloof and stern, but was professional. We would definitely stay here again if we visit this beautiful city in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: photogal06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wedgewood Hotel in downtown Vancouver for our third anniversary and were not disappointed in the least! Our room was rather spacious and located on the east side overlooking the courthouses, art museum and gardens. I have never seen an oversized bathtub located not in the bathroom, but in the sleeping area itself! Made it quite unique and fun!! Location of the hotel is near most shopping and restaurants so it makes things quite accessible.Service was extremely prompt and courteous in everything that they did. We needed extra coffee....and there it was....in less than 5 minutes!! The front desk was always helpful and able to answer our every question about Vancouver. The lounge area was romantic, mysterious and comfortable for either drinks, dessert, or breakfast! When we come back to Vancouver in the future, we would definately stay at the Wedgewood again! Dinner at West again too!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: HM1MH1
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews for this hotel and others in Vancouver we decided to stay at the Wedgewood. It seemed that hands down it received the best over all reviews. Years ago we had stayed at Sutton Place and really liked it, but the reviews lead us to believe that it was not as nice as it was in the late 80's and 90's. I had gone on line to look at the rooms at the Wedgewood and did think they looked a little "tired" but decided to stay there anyway because we like small hotels and booked a junior suite. Needless to say, we were very disappointed with the tired, outdated rooms and bathroom. There were no towel racks to hang the towels on in the small bathroom and the cheap oversized plastic waste paper basket was wedged between the toilet and the toilet paper holder. The tv in the bedroom was situated high in the corner of the bedroom on the type of platform you would find in a hospital room. And the room safe was from another era altogether. Also when we were checking out of our room we dediced not to call the bellman as our two bags were on wheels. However we forgot that there are stairs leading down to reception from the eleavators (why they don't have a ramp, especially for a handicap person, makes no sense) and as we were going down the stairs (with a bellman just standing there) my husband's bag ended up falling down the stairs, breaking the handle. The hotel was clean and the bed comfortable, and I think that with a major renovation this could be a lovely hotel, but I know I will not stay there again in it's present condition.

Reviews.Title: “great service, but needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: Ex-LA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe one bedroom suite for four nights, on the fourth floor. We arrived but our room wasn't ready- they generously offered to buy us a cocktail in the bar- after we walked outside to stretch our legs after the flight in, we came back in and had a drink- the desk clerk then told me that the free drink offer was rescinded since the room had since been readied. WTF? I was pretty put off by the whole encounter and was bummed that I was starting off my vacation on a totally negative note over a stupid, inconsequential decision by a stupid inconsequential desk clerk. Very irritating and highly unprofessional. Sorry: no more axe grinding! The remainder of the hotel staff were very friendly, helpful, and polite. Generally outstanding service from top to bottom. Maid service was exemplary; a drain was clogged in our room- an engineer was up to fix it inside five minutes. Very professional. The hotel facilities are very dated: the carpets aren't threadbare or worn, but they sure are old. The rooms were very clean but the furnishings were old, (but necessarily in poor repair). The decor is very dowdy. Perhaps stylish many years ago, but those days are gone- The Wedgewood reminds me of the Drake Hotel in Chicago: its best days are long past. The location is very central to downtown- everything is walking distance. Fun restaurants (Bin 941), cool clubs, awesome shopping, and Granville Island are within a few short blocks. Stanley Park is a short 12-15 minute walk north. I would not stay here again. The very dated decor, low ceilings, and dark hallways are not to my taste. I think this hotel badly needs a renovation to justify its exorbidantly high prices. However the service is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “purely pampered”
Reviews.Author: Lewesbeacher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our experience at the Wedgewood Hotel and Spa. Our room was tastefully decorated and the eveing turn down service was a pleasant surprise! The staff was very helpful. The restaurant was exquisite! The hotel lobby was lavish and tastefully decorated. We used the complimentary computer room and the exercise room as well. The doorman was dressed in a coat with tails and a top hat...a nice touch! We recommend this place to anyone who enjoys pampering! We only stayed 4 days and I regret that I didn't have enough time to indulge in the spa, although I did meet a woman who was treating herself to a spa package and said she loves the Spa at the Wedgewood....maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedgewood!!”
Reviews.Author: iliketoeaticecream
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wedgewood Hotel for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon trip to Canada. It is a really nice hotel, very flashy and 5 star! The staff are excellent, very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located right next to Robson street. It is a very central location. And although in a busy part of town, the rooms are very quiet. We stayed in a King room. It had a king size bed which was really comfortable, marble bathroom, mini bar with fridge. It was a spacious room, including a large bath tub in the main room area so you could sit in the bath and watch tv at the same time! The room was cleaned daily, nothing was missed. Each day you get free cookies and a bottle of water, which is a nice touch. There is free wireless access too. On our first night there we were given a bottle of sherry and a few sweet treats because it was our honeymoon. That was really nice!! This hotel is expensive, but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: traveledfar
Reviews.Content: We had a large suite that was lovely but the furniture was not that comfortable.Depending on who was at the front desk the service could be excellen to poor. Breakfast and lunch in the restaurant were delicious and I did not think it was outrageously expensive. I just wish my check in process had been more pleasant and that the manager had actually called me when I asked for that to occur. I thought the assistant managet was very inefficient.. I think that this hotel can be wonderful when things go smoothly which did occur after the first day. For the price paid I expected top notch service in every regard on a regular basis. The location is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: NomadLeicsUK&Spain
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms and decor are super combined with a great location (if there is such a thing in downtown Vancouver). The location being very close to downtown Vcr gets busy in the small lounge/breakfast room with non residents. In our view this hotel is extremly pretentious, A Maitre`d that floats around whilst the hard working breakfast staff cant cope and need help, food that is pretty to look at and very adventourous but falls well short of haute cuisine. Whilst the rooms are comfortable and spacious and the cookies at night are a nice touch, there the most expensive cookies you will ever buy. Overall a very expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Callia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights for part of our honeymoon and just thought it was wonderful. We really feel like we couldn't have picked a better hotel in Vancouver. The lobby, bar and restaurant are beautifully decorated - very opulent. We spent many an hour enjoying cocktails in the bar in the evening - it had a wonderful atmosphere. We enjoyed 2 evening meals in the restaurant which were superb, the food was out of this world. The breakfasts managed to better those that we had enjoyed in our hotel in Banff - an impressive achievement! We were lucky enough to be given an upgrade to our room, which was beautiful. It had a balcony with a great view of the Art Gallery and the city, and a spa bath in the corner of the room. The bathroom was lovely with a huge walk-in shower. It was a nice touch that someone left cookies for us each evening when they did the turn-down service. All the staff were extremely helpful and polite - we felt very at home even though it was obviously a big treat for us to be staying in a hotel of this quality. The bar and restaurant service was extremely organised and attentive - they seemed to anticipate things you need before you thought of them yourself! The location of the hotel couldn't have been better - it really is in the heart of downtown. We were very sad to leave and would love to travel back one day to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klowilson
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful stay at the Wedgewood. The staff were extremely friendly, courteous and professional - nothing was too much trouble. Our room was fabulous - wonderful big bed, amazing bath, and a lovely balcony with great views out over the city. A highlight was an amazing English Afternoon tea which was better than any I've had at the Ritz in London. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “incredible hotel, rooms and service were outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Steve/Pina
Reviews.Content: This review is coming a little late....but we wanted to give the proper cudos to this hotel. We stayed here in Aug/2006 for 2 nights, our first time in Vancouver, then off to a week long Alaskan cruise. We really enjoyed this hotel, the service and ambiance were great. Do check the rooms on their web-site, the pictures are very helpful, and the rooms are exactly as described. Very nicely decorated and very comfortable. Room service was great, as well as the concierge and valet parking staff. We tried the nice restaurant downstairs one night, and the food was great! The front desk gave us great directions and tips for our day cruise to Whistler, very helpful! All in all, a very pleasant experience, and worthy of it's 5 star rating and rave tripadvisor reviews. Next time we are in Vancouver, we wouldn't go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_well055
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel extensively, he, internationally, I, mostly in North America, so for our Anniversary, we decided on a weekend at home away from home and chose to spend it at the Wedgewood. Having been at their restaurant, the Bacchus, repeatedly, we knew that the food would be wonderful, but we had never stayed at the hotel. It was a truly unique experience! Our suite was luxurious and comfortable with an understated elegance one usually finds in a well loved home. The bathrooms done in beautiful lime stone, offered an all-glass double walk-in shower in the one and a jetted double soaker tub in the other, complete with bath salts and pillar candles, very romantic touch! Upon arrival, the young lady at the Front Desk gave us a very warm welcome, and throughout the weekend everyone was pleasant and friendly without exceeding the boundaries. In our room we found a bottle of English Sherry with delicious home made truffles and a happy anniversary note from the owner and every night the turn down girls left warm home made cookies and bottled water by the bedside. The highlight of our weekend was our visit to their Spa - always to be reserved well in advance. Dressed in fluffy terry robes and slippers we went down to the Spa, first to spend a half hour in their Eucalyptus steam room, which was followed by an unbelievable facial called the Ultimate Cinnamon Enzyme Facial for me and the Chai Soy Anti-Stress Back Treatment for my husband. We are now hooked for life!! A great weekend without the hustle of travelling! We'll definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SASNY
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood is a wonderful hotel in every respect. The rooms are lovely. The service is impeccable. The location is great. We arrived at the hotel before check-in time and our room was not ready. The woman at the desk suggested some places of interest nearby, and I asked some questions about some of the attractions we planned to visit during our stay. When we returned to the hotel a few hours later, this woman had taken the initiative during our absence to gather some information about the sights I'd asked about, and print the public transportation routes off the internet. That was a great service touch. Our room was beautiful and well appointed. Staff went out of their way during our stay to make sure we had everything we needed. The bar area is wonderful-- a great place to start with breakfast in the morning and end the evening with a nightcap. For those who, like me, prefer an elegant boutique hotel to a sterile chain, the Wedgewood is the perfect spot in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect ,Intiimate, and Charming--Our favourite Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: footdoctor7
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood Was Perfect, just as Perfect as Vancouver on a Sunny Day We just returned home after a wonderful trip to B.C and a 3 night stay at the Wedgewood our third visit to this beautiful one of a kind intimate hotels. We had friendly and genuine service and a warm welcome in both the lobby and in our room with the special gifts. Dining in Bacchus was exceptional and a pleasant romantic atmoshphere--and a very likeable watier who was very helpful with our menu selections. There is nothing really like spring in Vancouver and the Wedgewood reflects this feeling with their arrangements of flower boxes at the entrance and throughout the hotel. Our room had a balcony with a sitting area and views of Robson Square, which was great for people watching. . We have looked at some of the newer boutique hotels however there is nothing that can match the warmth, intimacy and character of the Wedgewood. We will return to the Wedgewood again this summer to experience this jewel of a hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: burtiebassett
Reviews.Content: stayed at the wedgewood for 5 nights and can not praise it enough from check in after a long flight to a very early morning check out everything was great,lovely suite with some nice touches(biscuits and sherry on arrival) homemade cookies and bottled water each night. room service was good and had a great meal in the bacchus restaurant quite pricey but not too expensive for a special treat, location was very central but vancouver is not an enormous city and we found it very walkable.All in all we would go again and be happy to stay at the wedgewood.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Max100
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days in the Wedgewood recently in a one-bedroom suite. I really have mixed feeling about the place. Let me explain! The Wedgewood is a non-descript (70s office-schlock) building with a dirty canopy over the entrance. Not a good entrance. For 'one of the best hotels in Canada' and the 'best boutique hotel it was incredibly disappointing. Inside is a mish-mash of faux decor, heavily dated. Made me feel instantly like we made the wrong choice. I waned to walk out. In another city, it would have been downright cheap. No joking. Nasty-looking faux facade (clearly visible) on the reception area, low ceilings in the foyer with tiled mirrors on those same ceilings. Tiled mirrors! Ouch! I thought they went out in the 70s. And here's my beef: I really couldn't get over how dated downtown Vancouver was at street level. Tacky signage. More than a fair share of drifters. And the Wedgewood kept pace with that, but we're taking a 70s/80s pace. Read on! For one of the best rooms in the hotel, the one-bedroom suite was extremely disappointing (I'm being polite here!). It was really a decent-sized room that had a wall inserted down the middle to create the bedroom/sitting room divide. But if anyone had the sense to see it, it would have been far more cosy to have no wall in the first place and leave it at one good-sized room. Instead we had two awkward long narrow rooms, and ended up skirting around the end of the bed (in the bedroom) and the side of the tv (in the 'lounge room'). Rather than a luxurious hotel bedroom suite, it actually ended up feeling like a badly designed cheap apartment. We had an 8th floor view over Robson Square (a building site) but there are far better views to be had in Vancouver from far cheaper hotel rooms. Generally, the hotel felt as if it was squeezed into a building that did not accommodate what it was trying to do. Nowhere was this more apparent than when you arrived in the 'spa floor'. The spa is on the second floor. But it has clearly been recently created and shoved into a low ceiling floor where previously there were bedrooms. Shortly after leaving the lift on the second floor and entering the spa reception, you are overwhelmed by a nasty locker-room smell, as if there is no air getting in. As you look around, the cause is easy to see. The ceiling is only slightly above your head, and there is no light or window in sight. We left that floor quickly. We did not book any spa treatments - it was inconceivable to arrive down to that floor to have a treatment, and feel like you were having a treat! Anything but. As for services: We emailed the Concierge ahead of our stay to book some (stated) restaurants. Simple phone-calls for the concierge as we had already picked the restaurants. Although, to be fair, we did ask for a 'new and upbeat restaurant' recommendation on the first night - and they came up trumps with Chambar. Excellent. But we also put 3 different requests to them about trips (to Victoria etc.). When we arrived, we were introduced to the 'head' concierge, and other than a simple direction to the local 'hop-on-hop-off'' tour shuttle, we got little help on any of our other requests. In fact, we left with the distinct impression that he could do nothing for us. Let me put this into perspective: I had seen on the net that there was a particular classical music performance in Vancouver and asked him to book a ticket. He not only said that he 'was not familiar' with where the performance was on, but had tried to contact them but got no response. And there it was left. I was shoved a page with the contact details, and the impression he could do no more. I already had the page he gave me from the internet. For a 5* hotel on my vacation, I wanted the 'here are the tickets you requested' or 'I haven't been able to secure them so far but I am trying all the time to get them and I will let you know as soon as I have word' service. And I would have tipped accordingly. But no. Any concierge worth their salt would have insisted that they were constantly trying to get me tickets, and got them, as they were easily available. Poor show. We didn't consult the concierge for anything after that. When you read the guide books, the Wedgewood constantly gets this 'best service' and 'cute touches' accolades. Hmmmm. Ok, when we got to our 'suite', we had a note and a box of chocolates from the owner welcoming us. Every evening, a sultry housekeeper delivered water and cookies. All that's nice. But, it was perfunctory. And it could never offset the other problems. The room itself (apart from the ill-advised wall-split), was passable. Tacky, dated curtains, like a bad bed&breakfast. Ouch!! Only saving grace was the very comfortable bed thankfully. Top class linen. And equally with towels in the bathroom. And very nice bathroom, but again awkwardly designed (no place to hang a towel etc.). In the context of the rest of the room, the bathroom was all out of place. It was faux-roman decor and really an awkward mix - it was as if they spent a lot of money on the bathrooms, but couldn't care about the bedrooms. So, is there anything good about the Wedgewood? The Bacchus restaurant is. We dined in the best restaurants in Vancouver (C, West, Tojos), but I have to say the Bacchus nailed it with the best of them. Again, in keeping with the rest of the hotel, it's all the same dated decor (like they haven't done anything to it for decades) but they kind of have it a bit right on the luxurious-decadent front. Heavy curtains, low lighting etc. The food is spot-on. It's heavy rich French-style food, but I couldn't recommend it more if that's what you want. If I was visiting Vancouver again, I would not stay at the Wedgewood. I'd go back to Bacchus, but not the rooms. We got to realise that Vancouver is all about its natural beauty. Snow-capped mountains, beaches, pacific ocean and the largest city park in North America, not to mention the mod glass sky-scrapers hugging the water. Given that, I would in future go to one of the high-rise hotels that has the best views of this natural beauty. And probably those near the water. I understand most of the Vancouver high-rise hotels are dated-conference-hotels (which is why we picked the Wedgewood!) but after being in what is Vancouver's best 'boutique hotel', I would very gladly take a large standard conference hotel room with a view any day over the poor value and expectations that were sadly under-served at the Wedgewood. Best of luck!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: pegomh
Reviews.Content: I wanted to try this hotel because of the location to shopping - I normally stay at the Pan Pacific. I was not disappointed. We tried out the sauna in the spa and the amenities were excellent - great on a cold and rainy day. They have computers in the business center which are free - with small screens and slow access but better than nothing! Every single hotel staff that we encountered asked if they could do anything for us - every one was friendly and kind. The bathroom was my favorite - oversized tub and gorgeous tile. Hand held shower head - both the towels and the sheets were of the highest quality. I will definitely stay at this hotel again. We didn't try the bar or restaurant instead went down the street to the restaurant at the Blue Horizon hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury and good service!”
Reviews.Author: abrahams
Reviews.Content: I am embarrassed that it has taken me so long to post this review, as we stayed at the Wedgewood over 1 yr ago. The service was outstanding, they see to your every need, altho we would have preferred a less aloufness. I can only assume the staff is trained to be a bit formal and rigid. That was okay, as it did fit the setting quite well. The food was excellent at the hotel, and we enjoyed evenings by the fireplace in the lounge.
