We strongly recommend the botanical gardens in Vancouver, we didn't have time to do much sight seeing, but the concierge steered us in that direction, and we loved it. I don't know that we will find ourselves in Vancouver anytime soon again, but if we do, we would highly recommend the Wedgewood!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spa!”
Reviews.Author: katiekatiekatie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wedgewood at the end of January when I was in Vancouver on a business trip. I enjoyed my stay. I was in an Executive room with two double beds and the room was very nice. Our room view was really only into the next building, but the weather wasn't the best so it didn't matter. I thought my bed was great. The bathroom was super clean - always a plus! I also had a facial at the Spa and loved every minute of that. The staff at the Spa were very gentle and my skin and I enjoyed the treatment very much.

Reviews.Title: “High praise for the Wedgewood in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRonnie
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Wedgewood Hotel in Vancouver to celebrate a special occasion with my guy. What a lovely boutique hotel! The service was friendly and efficient, the room was gorgeous, and the location was primo - right in downtown Vancouver. The place has the elegance of a city landmark, but has been updated to ensure a very comfortable stay. We went to the hotel's lounge (Bacchus) for drinks on Friday night, finding a seat by the big stone fireplace, and enjoying delish appies and martinis in a sophisticated room. We went back to Bacchus for a continental breakfast and enjoyed a small but fresh buffet. I'd definitely make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Love the chocolates and cookies”
Reviews.Author: sg_stef
Reviews.Content: No turndown service given throughout my stay - had to call to remind them to give me the cookies and bottle of mineral water every evening.... The cookies were big and soft. Very yummy. We arrived early and had to wait in the lobby for almost an hour for our room to be ready. We were given a room with a tub which we enjoyed very very much. The room had a nice view of the streets. Staff were friendly in a professional way. Excellent location within walking distance to shopping streets and most attractions. Overall a nice hotel to stay in but I wouldn't call it value for money - more for times when you'd like to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “A class act!”
Reviews.Author: walrus007
Reviews.Content: A very classy hotel. A box of high quality chocolates and a personalized hand written welcome note were already in the room. We stayed in one of the large suites with 2 separate bathrooms (not one of the penthouses). One has a roman marble shower and the other has a huge Jacuzzi tub with shutters that open up into the bedroom. An array of high-end toiletries in both bathrooms. The luxury bed was huge with top quality bedding. This is the cleanest hotel room we have ever stayed in. As soon as we pulled up and were greeted properly we new we had made a good choice. We visited the lively (even on a weekday) bar and stayed late, obviously popular with the rich, hip and unusual. If you enjoy requested birthday wishes from complete strangers and an oompa band announcing your arrival, stay somewhere else (please). This is a discreet hotel, there’s a reason it is popular with movie stars! Everything was handled efficiently and pleasantly, the staff are all pros. Lots of attention to detail such as the doorman ensuring that my wife got into the car with out getting her hair wet when it was raining. We are looking forward to our next stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Sexy! ;)”
Reviews.Author: MommyJessica
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood was fantastic. My husband and I stayed during the weekend of the finale of the Celebration Of Light fireworks. The staff was amazing. Not only did they leave chocolates and wine in the room for us, the housekeeping staff was pleasant and well trained and the valet staff was polite and courteous. I would definitely recommend this hotel to ANYBODY and we'll definitely be going back when we have the time!!

Reviews.Title: “nothing but praise”
Reviews.Author: DoctorNick
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood is elegance and service at its finest. Everything is done with a quiet class and attentiveness to details, from the service down to the quality of the linen. Could not recommend a hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. the good news was we were at The Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: Ledeuce
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness we were staying at The Wedgewood because it poured rain for the entire week. We found ourselves looking forward to returning to our hotel each day and night. The linens are lovely and the twice daily housekeeping visit was much appreciated. We decided to check out for two days for a quick visit to Whistler and the hotel offered to keep some or our luggage so that we could travel lightly. Oh yes and the location is just great. We will definitely stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marta Hari
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading other reviews on the site. As others have said it is centrally located but not noisy. You can walk anywhre in central Vancouver from here. The room was very comfortable including a bath in the corner of the bedroom as well as a shower room. We had a balcony which we were lucky enough to be able to sit out on in October. There were chocolates in the room when we arrived and cookies every night. The staff were helpful and attentive. The bar is a lovely place to sit but it gets very crowded in late afternoon. The restaurant was also very good though a bit dark. The spa and gymn are small but well equipped and the steam room was easy to use and got going quickly. The business centre was empty every time we used it and had 2 computers for internet access. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bacchus Restaurant / Bar tops my list”
Reviews.Author: excanuck
Reviews.Content: I had our top clients in Vancouver from the U.K. One of them is well traveled and a gourmet fiend. I was hosting a dinner and chose Bacchus Restaurant at the Wedgewood Hotel because I trusted them completely to make the evening a success - and they did, in spades. Our waiter helped me negotiate through the wine list so I didn't bankrupt our company but didn't embarass ourselves in front of our clients. The service throughout the dinner was superb and lacked nothing. The food presentation was terrific and everyone enjoyed their choice. Most importantly, the service was sincere and not put-on - the team clearly wanted to ensure our dinner was perfect. Prior to dinner, we had cocktails in the bar - Christine, our server, was super attentive and adapted to the various "styles" of our guests - some were serious , some were more relaxed - she "read" each perfectly. Our clients have entered into a long term partnership with our company because they value the commitment to high quality and service we think our company delivers. When asked why I chose to bring them to Bacchus at the Wedgewood - I said for the same reason - I value them and more importantly, trust them to do the right thing - all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: pdchi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vancouver for our honeymoon and stayed at the Wedgewood for two nights. Overall, the Wedgewood was a lovely experience. When we arrived, the bellman was excellent and helpful throughout our stay. He had tips for food, sights and travel. The front desk was also helpful. We booked through expedia and were given a room with two beds. We requested one bed as we were on our honeymoon. The front desk was able to give us a room with a queen which was nice. The staff at the Wedgewood does like it if you can book through the hotel for more service. i.e. they would know it was your honeymoon etc. They did give us a gift of chocolates for our celebration which was sweet. The service at the hotel was wonderful. The front desk made reservations at restaurants for us quickly and the housekeeping staff was equally kind. Very friendly staff. On a very minor note, the first night of turndown service we didn't get the famous warm cookies and water but other than that, the service was great. The room was small and the tv was very small. The balcony was great!!! It made the small room seem much larger. The Bacchus restaurant was fabulous. We had the tasting menu and was very pleased with the food and service and decor. The bar is excellent. Only thing I'd change is get rid of the singing piano player and go with instramental only. The waitress at the bar was probably the only indifferent person we encountered. Great atmoshphere in the lounge!!! The spa seemed nice but it was hard to get an appointment that fit our schedule since it appears to be small and we cancelled our appointments. The steam room and gym were also nice but the steam was a little too in the open for our tastes. The business center was great too. The price is high at the hotel and maybe other boutique hotels offer more but the service is excellent, the food is great and the location is perfect! I would definitely recommend The Wedgewood!

Reviews.Title: “hotel exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: hotelshopper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were desperate for a place to stay after a horrible night in another hotel the night before. Following a Vancouverite's recommendation, we called the Wedgewood and a short while later we were welcomed by their friendly doorman who proceeded to introduce us to the Front Desk clerk, equally friendly and very accommodating with all of our questions and special requests. This place truly exceeded all our expectations!!! We stayed in one of their Deluxe Executive rooms, and we were wonderfully surprised by how very spacious and very luxurious it was, all in a tasteful understated way. Beautiful semi-canopied beds feature the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in with individually controlled reading lights, while a double soaker tub is right in the bedroom with a marble walk in shower in the bathroom. The amenities were great, but the warm cookies and bottled water at night were a real treat. We didn't have the opportunity to see any of their suites, or their famous new Penthouses which are apparently the current hot spots for Hollywood celebrities, but if our luxurious room is one of their second lowest categories, we can only imagine what their Penthouses must be like!!! What is outstanding though about this hotel is the friendliness of their Staff. They seem to have invented the word "service". From their delightful Executive Housekeeper, to the courteous room service attendant and very professional waiters. They all make you feel very much at home. We especially enjoyed our dinner in Bacchus. What a romantic room and the food was delicious. We couldn't get an appointment in their Spa, but we will make a point of trying it on our next visit. This is definitely one of the best places we have ever stayed - would recommend it without a second thought!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Wedgewood is the BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_LD
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in one of the newly rennovated penthouse suites at the Wedgewood, and it was AMAZING!!!! We had a gorgeous, spacious living room with a fireplace and a big bathroom with a double size jacuzzi tub that opened into the bedroom. It was beautiful and truly first class. The bellman told us that Pierce Brosnan had just vacated our room after finishing his lastest movie! We had room service for dinner one night, and our waiter fussed over us to make sure everything was perfect! The food was delicious and in the mornings we had breakfast in our bathrobes on our private terrace - it felt like a scene out of Pretty Woman! I had a facial in the Spa that was the best I've ever had, and a fabulous massage. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!! This a great hotel. It has a very cosy, personal feel about it and the staff really make you feel like they care. There is a very hip crowd at the bar downstairs too, which is fun. If you are looking for a great place to stay in Vancouver with excellent service and a prime location - look no further! Book one of the new penhouse suites if you can - they are worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: bdhaus
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood hosted our Wedding ceremony in early September. We are living in Florida but traveled to Vancouver to share our celebration with family. The staff at the Wedgewood made the entire event, from planning to post-event, a remarkable experience. They epitomize "outstanding service". We were so pleased with the experience that we chose the hotel to pamper mom with an afternoon at their spa for her birthday. The look on her face afterwards was "priceless". Thanks!! Brian and Cynthia

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: JoJoP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in several "boutique" hotels all over the world, and decided to give the Wedgewood a try. I was very pleased our initial experience. The bellmen were courteous and helped us from our taxi promptly. They announced our arrival to the Front Desk before we entered the hotel and so they were waiting for us when we approached the lobby area. This is where it seemed to fall apart. I felt like we were interrupting a social gathering, and the staff wisked us away without asking if we needed any help with planning our special getaway. On the few occasions I wentto the front desk, I again, felt as though I was a nuisance to the staff. We ate in the Bachus restaurant and it was fabulous! The setting and atmosphere was just right! All in all, we enjoyed ourselves, but the atmosphere in the Lobby was just a little too relaxed and informal for my liking. It was not as professional as I would have expected from this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: KCLRK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating a special anniversary so we decided to go to the most talked about hotel in our city and we were certainly not disappointed. We had such a great weekend at the Wedgewood, that we've decided to make it a yearly tradition. The location is amazing, steps away from all the stores, restaurants and theatres and the service couldn't have been more professional and friendly at the same time. We stayed at a Wedgewood Suite beautifully decorated in cool brown and gold tones, silk fabrics and two luxurious spa bathrooms complete with pillar candles and bath salts for the double jetted tub - very romantic!! Breakfast in bed was wholesome and elegantly served, but their Spa was the highlight of our stay. We had to make reservations way in advance because it's so popular and we saw why. They offer a variety of interesting treatments, some for couples. a great eucalyptus steam room and the aestheticians were some of the best we've ever tried. My wife has already made a second appointment. Their Lounge and Restaurant, Bacchus is definitely the place to see and be seen by the elite of Vancouver. We had a great dinner the first evening and just dessert and drinks late the second evening. We will return often. Ken Clark

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room but...”
Reviews.Author: G102000
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful and the housekeeping service was impeccable but I have to say I was not impressed with the rest of the staff and for this reason I will probably not stay there again. I would expect the staff of a hotel of this caliber to provide excellent customer service and I agree with another reviewer that the front of house staff seemed young and not polished. When we arrived by Taxi we carried our bags into the hotel while the kid working the valet stayed at his stand. Not once during our stay did the gentlemen working the valet open the door for us and greet us. All we received was a smile as they continued to talk to each other about there personal lives. The front desk/concierge staff were cordial but did not go out of there way to make us feel welcome. In contrast when we went to the Wickaninnish Inn in Torfino they went out of their way to make us feel welcome. When we arrived they met our taxi offloaded our luggage and brought it to the check in desk. The person who cehcked us in then escorted us to our room and informed us about the particulars of our room, the hotel, and the area. Every time we would leave or arrive they would open the door and would ask us how our day was and if there is anything we needed. When we would ask the concierge about an activity or restaurant she would offer to book a reservation. The morning we left they had coffee waiting for us at check out. That is what I would have expected from the Wedgewood.

Reviews.Title: “Can't see what the fuss is about.”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in a "Junior Suite". The hotel is a converted apartment building and the room decor is tired 80s "Four Seasons". My "suite" had a view of an alley and I could reach out and touch a powerline. The lobby is small and elegant the restaurant is outstanding and very clubby. The bar has an upmarket "meat market" feeling to it. The lifts are tiny and very slow. The technology is dated. No wifi, actual room keys to lug around, etc. The service is decent but I really don't see what the fuss about this hotel is all about. Plenty of better options in YVR.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but...”
Reviews.Author: fatbaloo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wedgwood in April 2006 and paid about $200 per night. The rooms were very nice and we enjoyed the large tub in the bedroom. However, the service at this hotel is best described as indifferent. The front desk (more of a corner desk actually) was not helpful. The staff seemed young (I am 36) with very little insight into the local sights or how to even get around. They are not rude or even unpleasant but just don’t seem to really care. I don’t blame them but I also would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is not familiar with the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: ziggydssp
Reviews.Content: We recently completed a three night stay at the Wedgewood. Our stay was thoroughly enjoyable. First let me say the lobby is just gorgeous. More so than what can be captured in a photo. It's the overall feeling of warmth and beauty that impressed me. The dining room was also very beautiful. We stayed in a junior suite which was very spacious. I don't think the pictures on the hotel's web site do them justice. Our room was much more dynamic than it appeared on the web site. The room showed no signs of wear and tear, it was obvious to us that the hotel pays strict attention to detail and they keep the hotel immaculate. The decor in our room was simply beautiful. Everything from the wallpaper to the drapes to the bed was just wonderful. The bathroom was very beautiful. It had a separate marble shower and a deep soaking tub. The chocolates upon arrival were a nice touch and very delicious. Upon learning that we were celebrating our 20th anniversary they brought us a bottle of Harvey Bristol Cream. That was very thoughtful. The service at the hotel was very cordial. Everything we asked for, they provided withoug hesitation. I definitely recommend the Wedgwood for almost any occasion but certainly for special occasions. Let me admit that I had originally booked the Wedgwood and then cancelled the reservation because I was lured by the comments regarding the view the from Pan Pacific Hotel. Boy was that a mistake. The view was not very good, our room faced a big crane. They could of cared less about the fact we were celebrating our 20th anniversary. Our check in experience at the Pan Pacific was such a bad experience, we checked out and called the Wegdewood. They welcomed us with open arms and rescued the celebration of our 20th anniversary. For that we thank them.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed the Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: Mid40sTravellers
Reviews.Content: Three of us girls rented a junior suite and had a spa day and pajama party. The staff was wonderful, the service was prompt, we loved the extra little touches. The spa treatments were out of this world. Our room had a balcony on the 10th floor. The hotel is beautiful, it was a great choice and we would highly recommend it. A great time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay at the Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: asiln28
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I spent a few nights at the Wedgewood Hotel at the end of Oct 2005. We loved the hotel. Like others who've reviewed this hotel, we were upgraded to a suite. There were complimentary chocolates - such a treat! The hotel looked a little stuffy, but the staff certainly wasn't. The room was really spacious, and the bathroom was spectacular. It had a separate shower area with a glass door, along with a full bath. The cookies at turndown made us feel truly pampered. We ate one evening at Bacchus. The food was fantastic, but we were a bit unprepared wardrobe-wise for the elegance. Despite our being underdressed, we got the same special service as everybody else. My one complaint was that sometimes the water pressure was low, & there was little hot water. Aside from that, I LOVED my stay. The hotel is in a great location - easy to access the shopping & great restaurants that Vancouver has to offer. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Highly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: LoveWineAndGardens
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite at the Wedgewood for 2 nights. It was slightly smaller than I envisioned for the price, but very comfortable. Lovely bathroom, very comfortable bed, and a fairly quiet room for the middle of downtown. The location is great: you can walk to dozens of really great restaurants, and I felt quite safe walking at 11pm at night because there were so many other people out and about. The staff were courteous and efficient--no complaints there. Although their restaurant, Bacchus, has a very good breakfast, for something lighter you might want to try walking one block down Hornby to Caffe Artigiano, across from the Vancouver Art Museum, for some very artistic coffee and wonderful pastries. I wish I'd had both my breakfasts there! Be sure to call the Wedgewood when making reservations. Their reservation website did not show any junior suites available, only more expensive suites, but when we called, they did have the less expensive junior suite available for our stay. FYI, the prices you see when you check availablity are much cheaper than those posted next to the room descriptions. We ended up paying C$331 for the first night, C$298 for the second night (Sunday night special). I would definitely stay there again. It was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wedgewood a delightful boutique”
Reviews.Author: canadianlawyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wedgewood for two nights while my boyfriend was on business. It's a beautiful boutique hotel with fantastic service. The little touches were great - a welcome box of chocolates (about 10!), ice in the bucket on the bar of our deluxe room, turndown service with homemade cookies. We had a lovely room with a bed we didn't want to get out of, a soaker tub for two and a balcony overlooking the street, but it was still a quiet room. Great location downtown, close to shopping, restaurants and not too far from Stanley Park. Just a couple of small things prevented it from being the best hotel stay ever - for example, I would have liked a teaspoon with my breakfast tray for my coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at boutique hotel. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: FS_Junkie_with_kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wedgewood from 8-10 March 2006 with our two young children. It is a nice, recently updated hotel. It overlooks the UBC plaza on Hornby St. so you can see ducks paddling in the large rooftop pond. Half a block to the art museum and Robson St/Pacific Center for shopping and dining. Within two blocks to Four Seasons & Fairmont, if location is a deciding factor between those hotels for you. Bacchus Restaurant downstairs served us two good breakfasts with really wonderful, attentive, tailored service (and the manager and server made us feel really at home and amongst friends). Overall my two favorite things about the hotel are the service and location. The front desk, concierge and bell desk were friendly on numerous occasions, always one step ahead in anticipating our needs. When I called to ask for a bellperson to help us with our bags during our departure, he immediately asked about transportation and offered to confirm the van taxi we had asked for. The concierge recommended the restaurant, Savory Coast on Robson, which was an absolutely wonderful, delicious taste of Vancouver dining at its best with a Mediterranean flair (and the staff there was AWESOME). We had a very pleasant stay at this boutique hotel. Check online for reduced rates prior to departure. I saw a reduced rate and called to change my reservation to reflect the lower rates without any difficulty.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: computergirl
Reviews.Content: My first experience with this hotel was for a conference and I was blown away by their exemplary service. Friendly smiles meet you at the door and the genuine caring for our every need was fantastic. Our setting for the meetings was more than just a conference room, it had beautiful furnishings and even a fireplace. The meeting coordinator handled every detail and stopped in often to ensure all was running smoothly. The meals - fabulous - my compliments to the chef. Our rooms were beautiful, spacious and very clean. The little details such as evening cookies were so appreciated. Many of us have recommended this hotel since the conference as we all enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Where even the small things count”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I want to let you know just how wonderful, helpful and downright pleasent the whole staff at this Hotel are from the Bell Hops, Front Desk, Resturant Staff, Maids and all the managers. They treat you as someone special not just another traveller. For me it is a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a romantic getaway! My wife and I stayed in a deluxe executive room. There was a jaccuzzie in the main part of room beside the bed that you can roll into in the morning and watch the news on TV from. A few things that pleased me were the portable phone, so I didn’t have to sit by the bed to use it and the decent sized balcony (that you could actually walk out onto) that looked over the law courts and had a table chair setting. Homemade cookies and bottled water came with the turning down of our bed, and box a chocolates, compliments of the manager was waiting for us when we came back from shopping. They really make an effort to make you feel welcome. We popped in for dinner at Bacchus, the restaurant. From the street or from the lobby it looks like more of a small bar, a good place to catch a drink or a quick bite to eat. But when you actually get inside, there is a whole separate section tucked in behind the piano, closer to the kitchen. The recommended dish, Halibut is recommended for a reason. Don’t go there without eating it. We also had the salmon, but it was nothing special. For desert we had a cheese plate that came with fruits, crackers and bread, surprisingly filling. Quality live piano all night long really added to the atmosphere and made it a very ROMANTIC evening if I may say so. Because it’s reasonably priced (for fine dining,) I’d definitely go back to sample more of the menu. I’ve stayed at lots of other top class hotels before, but I think if you’re looking for somewhere with personality to really treat yourself or someone you know, there is no place better than the Wedgewood.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent host for our 2 day sales conference”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The 20 participants in our conference were unanimous in their praise of the service provided by each and every member of the hotel staff, from the first experience at check-in through to the incredibly attentive team that saw to our needs thoughout the day. The old world charm and general ambience of the hotel set the tone for our conference and certainly put the team in the right frame of mind for inventive and collaborative thinking. We would not hestitate to recommend the Wedgewood to customers, colleagues, friends , and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, and great cyclists!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to stay at the Wedgewood and attend "An Evening Of Champions" with cycling legends Eddy and Axel Merckx which was organised by the Wedgewood Hotel Cycling Team back in October. The evening was a dream come true not only meeting two great champions but stay at such a delightful hotel. I have followed The Tour de France on numerous occasions staying at some lovely French properties and have to say the Wedgewood compares with the best of them. The evening raised over $100'000 for the local Cancer Foundation which was quite an achievement and something I was very proud to be part of. Thank you Wedgewood for a great stay and a great event.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Most Ways”
Reviews.Author: Pelter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from spending a long winter weekend at the Wedgewood between Jan 4 and 8, 2006. After reading the near flawless reviews of the Wedgewood, with great anticipation we booked a junior suite. We found slightly lower pricing on the hotel's web site and ended up paying about $185 USD on average per night. We were assigned a room on 11th floor and, although close to the elevator, we couldn't hear a thing. Overall, the staff is fantastic and the hotel is well appointed but for those expecting a 'W' type room experience, the Wedgewood might be a little disappointing. While comfortable, the room had very small TVs and the bathroom, considering we were in a junior suite, was surprisingly small. While I still would rate the experience close to a 9 out of 10, we frankly thought the hotel room would have slightly better amenities. Bottom line, the Wedgewood with its top notch customer service and location will not disappoint, however, this likely won't be the best hotel experience in a major international city.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of pretension, not much polish”
Reviews.Author: YVR_guestservices
Reviews.Content: I was just at the Wedgewood for one night and was not as impressed with it as I had expected to be, based on the website and reviews. The blousy Olde Englishe decor is fussy and overbearing, and not even well executed - the woodwork is cheaply done and the hallways narrow and dimly lit. This may have been a "boutique" hotel at one time, but nowadays, people expect something a little smarter, classier and more polished. On the plus side, a great location, and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A classy small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: retiredconsultant
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find! Stay in the mini-suites - not much more money and gorgeous rooms. The bar and the restaurant in this hotel seem to be destinations in themselves for Vancouver residents. We only ate breakfast there, but when in the bar area saw others having appetizers that looked wonderful. The restaurant was packed each time we walked by. The spa is new; I didn't try it but would have had we stayed longer. The workout room is small but well equipped, complete with steam rooms, water bottles, and cold cloths for cooling down after a workout. Very pretty property, great service, nice location. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Initially having to decide between the Wedgewood Hotel and other highly rated Opus Hotel, my family decided to give the Wedgewood Hotel a chance, mostly because it appeared to us to have the more convenient location of the two. I stayed at the Wedgewood for 3 days in December 2005 before Christmas. Overall I would say the experience has been very pleasant. I booked 2 rooms, one for my family and the other for my parents, who arrived 3 days earlier. I made reservations directly with the hotel, whose manager assured me that I would get the same rates as found in other hotel booking sites. Having checking the charges in these sites, I was comfortable that that was the case. We made reservations for the Executive room but I was pleasantly surprised when they upgraded me to a Deluxe Executive upon my arrival. The Deluxe Executive room was a fairly large room with a good view and soaker tub in the room (not the bathroom). I would describe the hotel as smallish but with plenty of personality. The hotel's location makes it a definate plus - it's right in the middle of town and a good walking distance to all the good restaurants in the area. The staff were all pleasant and helpful. On our final night at the hotel we dined at the award winning Bacchus which greets you when the enter the hotel's main entrance. If you want a quiet dinning night out, forget it! The dinning area is practically in the bar area and the noise levels make conversation difficult. The food was above average but so were the prices. On the whole, I would recommend the Wedgewood to visitors to Vancouver and for those who prefer to be in the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in suburbia Vancouver but often like to stay in the city for a little night life. From the moment we walked in to the Wedgewood to the moment we left we were very well taken care of at the Wedgewood. The staff is very friendly and courteous, the room are very comfortable (we had one with a triangle soaker tub for two which faces the room), the lounge is exceptional......and the manager, Philip Meyer, always seems to be around to ensure you are having a good stay. the little extras like the bedside water, the evening cookies and the fitness facility that feels like home. The location is great from one perspective because it is a half block off Robson Street and bad from another .... because we spent alot of $$$ shopping. Oh well, that is what vacation is all about.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well From Driving up and the doormans nice welcome, He must of radio ahead our names...FrontDesk welcomed us by name nice touch...we had a amazing room service dinner our server named Paul was wonderful. The service for breakfast was not as good...but food made up for it. It's our 3rd time at The Wonderful WedgeWood Hotel We live in Vancouver and like to get away for a night or too every couple of months...We will be back...it's a great escape to relaxe and enjoy! Keiko MacDonald

Reviews.Title: “Incredible !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel 18 cities a month. Besides my private residence, The Wedgewood Hotel is the only property where I feel right at home. The personal touches are what make the place; the staff are impeccable, fun, personal and always go out of their way to make everyone feel extraordinarily special. The quality of products & amenities in the rooms speak for themselves. The Bacchus restaurant & lounge is also one of the finest in Vancouver, you will not be disappointed. Should you try this property, you’ll never leave!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vancouver!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood Hotel was one of the best hotel experiences I've had in all my travels around the world. I appreciate the smaller quaint hotels when traveling as the service is more personalized. This is definitely the case with the Wedgewood Hotel. From the time I gave my keys to the valet I felt very welcome at the hotel. The rooms are luxurious and comfortable. I highly recommend a room with the jacuzzi bathtubs. It was a great way to relax after a walking tour of the shops on Robson St. On top of the spacious rooms there is the Bacchus Bar and Lounge. All three meals offer a great selection of food and drinks to choose from. Once I ate at the hotel it was hard to find anything else in Vancouver that could compare. I highly recommend a stay at the Wedgewood Hotel. Vancouver is a great city and the Wedgewood Hotel makes it hard to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant/lounge”
Reviews.Author: Wornpassport
Reviews.Content: Several friends and I stopped by the Bacchus lounge on Friday night and had a fantastic time. Great atmosphere, wide array of late evening drinks (e.g., single malts, port, martinis, etc) and amazing desserts. We sampled three of their dessert options and were blown away. We've stayed at the Wedgewood before and marvelled at the service and the restaurant was no different. We were seated quickly and the wait staff was attentive but not intrusive. To top it off, we were brought (free of charge) a basket of seasonal fruit and nuts to graze on as we finished our drinks... Definitely one of the best rooms in the city, with service to match.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: ptpkn
Reviews.Content: We drove to Vancouver from Seattle for a mini-getaway right before the holidays. We wanted this trip to be special, and so we spent quite some time deciding which hotel to stay in. At the end we decided on Wedgewood. Big mistake. Upon our arrival, we were told we were placed in "penthouse suite," which we assumed was an upgrade - it wasn't! We have made a reservation for a USD$269+tax Executive Suite, which was supposed to have either a king or two twin beds (we requested a king in our reservation). The room we were placed in had a double bed! When we got to our room, we thought it was a mistake and called the reception to let them know. We were told it was the only room they had available, and that that's what executive suit was supposed to look like anyway. The room was tiny!! I'm attaching photos. That night, we were too tired to argue, so the next morning we talked to receptionist again, and were told that we should have "read the fine print" on Expedia (where we made the reservation), and that the king-size bed was "a request" from us they basically didn't have to meet. By the way, here's the description of the room from Wedgewood website: ****Executive Suite:***** Studio room with mini-bar and private balcony. Extremely spacious, bright and beautifully appointed, they are always in demand. Bedding - One King-Size Bed or Two Doubles. Just look at the pictures, please, and tell me if that's what you would expect from that description! Anyway, after complaining to three different people we got "an upgrade" for our second night, after which we were placed in a room with a king bed and a slightly larger living area with a nice soaking tub. The staff at the hotel made it look as if they were doing us a favor, they never apologized for our inconvenience and generally were arrogant throughout our stay. To top it off, my brand-new car was dented in valley parking (which by the way costs additional $26 per night) during our stay. We only found the dent after we drove a few hours away from Vancouver, so we didn't complain because, frankly, after all the "service" we received at the hotel we decided it was pretty useless. It was a small dent, but you can imagine it didn't add anything to our overall experience with our stay. Needless to say, I don't think we are ever coming back. For that $$$, there are other hotels to stay in the city were we are bound to get better service than this. Maybe if we were placed in the right room from the beginning our experience would have been better, it is the only way I can explain all the positive reviews on this website. But, as you can see, if you ever run into any problems during your stay, they are not going to go out of their way to remedy them. STAY AWAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “glad i chose it”
Reviews.Author: travelmaster
Reviews.Content: chose the wedgewood from reviews on here and was not dissapointed. Really nice rooms, and the place did have that 'cosy' feel. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lounge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in Vancouver and from time to time drop in for a glass of wine or a snack in the lounge of the Wedgwood. When it comes to pay the bill, the smiling waitresses (?miniconspiracy?) before they take the payment in the folder, always ask me : "do you need the change?". Smart strategy for extorting sometimes an overgenerous tip from you, as in the presence of your lady companion you are expected to be a gentleman and say "no". Really, an "European Hotel" type lounge !"

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but a decent value for a large city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a quality comparison, we like Marriott-type hotels, but prefer the boutiques. The Wedgewood definitely gets 'thumbs-up', but I don't necessarily see it as a must-do on any future visits. (Note- my wife really did love it.) We spent three nights at the Wedgewood (plus one at the Westin-Bayshore). For our anniversary, my wife and I visited Vancouver and picked the Wedgewood based on researching several sources. It's a very cozy, friendly feeling hotel in the middle of the downtown shopping area and is walking distance to shopping, food and the art museum (walking yes, but need I mention that it rains a lot in October?). The desk staff and room staff were all very friendly and helpful. The Wedgewood's overall value for us was the location and apartment-like feel of our one bedroom suite with balcony overlooking the park. If you want just a 'nice place to sleep', there appears to be a lot of decent places that can save your money (and you can buy your own cookies to eat while you turn down your own bed). You will want a car to do any sightseeing. The Room: Clean, and a great view from the balcony overlooking Robson Square. The king bed, linens and pillows were all very comfortable. Nice-sized modern bath with separate shower. All are a cut or two above average. Very clean room overall. You get a real key for your door. Service: Front desk staff was very helpful. Scott, the desk mgr, KNOWS his restaurants (thanks buddy, for Bin941 and Chambar)! The room staff was also very pleasant and prompt when we needed more towels. (Yes, there are cookies served with turn-down service... I can't get too excited since they're good, they're cookies but you are paying for them.) We didn't try the onsite restaurant or bar. Food is a big part of why we travel. These were the Vancouver restaurants recommended by the Wedgewood: 'Bin 941' is five blocks from the hotel. Funky tunes, very small (a little loud), hip and overall really, really excellent food and fun! Primarily a tapas menu and a great wine selection. ($100-$150C) 'Chambar': Outstanding!!! A Michelin-rated chef recently opened this great eatery. We eat out a lot and this was one of the top three restaurant meals we've ever had. Creative martini list and eclectic food (ostrich?!). Appetizer of mussels and fries/pommes frites was simply the best we've ever had. ($100-150C) Tojos (sushi). We picked this from the guidebooks because it was a must-do (NOT). Really good, but it almost ruined our trip because it was OUTRAGEOUSLY PRICED. It's out of the way from the Wedgewood, in a cheezy office building, doesn't have a great decor but the food was very good. We love sushi and sat at the bar to get the full experience. At the bar, you don't keep the menu and it's your responsibility to stop the chef. The guidebooks say to give the chef a budget and I strongly suggest to heed the warning! My wife and I had one small flask of sake and about four beers total. We also weren't overly-filled when it came time for the check.... (ooh, it's painful to re-live it)... $400!!! I figured later that the cash register rang to the tune of $40 every time the chef touched our plate. The chef smilingly told us to "please make sure and come back" - he just loved us! Forget your dream of deciphering the celebrity autographs on Tojo's wall and get your 'cold dead fish' someplace else. It was fun, it was a good meal and it was a rip-off. Ya kinda just walk away feeling used. Vancouver is a great city with a lot of things to do (bring rainwear) and a lot of really good places to eat. People everywhere are very friendly. The Wedgewood is also a very nice place to stay and we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: alonzogo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "deluxe one-bedroom suite" for four nights, and I agree with all of the rave reviews. The hotel is relatively small, which I think enables a warmer, more intimate atmosphere than is possible in a large hotel. Very romantic, good for couples (we got married while staying there). Since nothing is perfect, I would point out that the bathroom was really too small, although well appointed; the TV hanging from a corner of the bedroom ceiling was a bit Motel 6, and the small TV in the living room looked lost in the giant armoire. But overall, the location on Robson Square cannot be beat, the staff is exemplary, and the room was luxurious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Beautiful Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MeetmeinSanJuan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wedgewood earlier this month for two nights as part of our family vacation. It was pleasant. We had an executive room that was nice and comfortable. There was a small bar with stools and a minibar toward the entrance of the room. The bathroom was large with a great, deep tub. Turn-down service was a nice touch, with the cookies and water. We had a large balcony, with chairs. I'll admit that our view was terrible. We were on the left side of the buidling, and despite previous requests to have a room facing the art gallery, our veiw was of the Sheraton across the alley. The staff was generally friendly. Cameron, the bellhop, was always recommending great places to go or eat at. (Cameron recommended The Blue Water Cafe. It's a great restaurant which I also highlyrecommed. It's expensive, but you really get what you pay for.) The people at the front desk were always smiling, with the exception of one man, who we kept having to remind to bring the mini-bed up to our room, and would sometimes would "forget" to smile. Overall, this is a 5-star hotel, with 5-star accomadations and a 4-star veiw and service. Regardless, my family and I enjoyed our stay at the Wedgewood Hotel and hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: daccas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel was beatifully presented and our room was spacious and included a very large bath tub which was accessed directly from the bedroom area - very original! The service was fine although one of the receptionists (long blonde hair) always struggled to raise a smile! The hotel is situated in a very good place, right in the heart of Vancouver and within walking distance of pretty much anything. No complaints at all and the cookies were a nice little extra. It makes you wonder why other hotels don't do a similar thing. Its funny how something that costs a hotel so little is the one thing most people remember....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: CindynGA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights last week. I had booked many months in advance for a suite ($350 per night rate). We were visting with our 13 year old son and wanted to be sure to have a king bed with a pull-out sofa. When we arrived, they said "we are UPGRADING you to a one bedroom suite"....we thought we were in for something great. The room we received was a one bedroom suite, but it was very small. It did face the nice side of the street (the art side with a fountain view), and it had a small balcony. Our bathroom had a soaker tub/shower combination and one sink. It was tiny. The furniture was typical hotel flare....nothing fancy. There were two 19 inch televisions, a mini bar, and small table. The first night I called the front desk around 8:30 and requested early turn down service as we were exhausted from traveling all day. ( I had read such wonderful things about the service here and was looking forward to the cookies. ) A few moments later, the maid knocked on the door. She handed my husband 2 plates of cookies and two waters and left. I ran to catch her and told her we have 3 people in our room so we need an additional water. She handed it to me without a word of apology. I asked her to please turn down the sofa bed for us. She came in and acted like we were ridiculous to want her to do it for us. The next night, we came in about 10pm and our "turn down service" had been done....no sofa bed pull-out, ONE plate of cookies and ONE water, and only two bath towels (for three people). I called to get more towels and again someone came right away but there was no apology. We had breakfast in the hotel's restuarant. They were very busy that morning. My son ordered waffles. They came out without syrup and he had to wait another 10 minutes (until my husband finally flagged down the waiter) to get his promised syrup. The waiter brought over a plate of chocolates and apologized. (chocolates, for breakfast? No thanks). Each time we walked into the hotel lobby we were NEVER greeted by the staff behind the desk. They would just watch us walk right by them. "Friendly" is not a word I would use here. For the amount of money, I wish I would have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: JohnEverson
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood more than lived up to our expectations - sumptuously comfortable without being aloof, right down to the complementary Belgian chocolates. We had to tell them to hold the cookies which kept arriving or we'd both have been like balloons by the end of our stay. Breakfast in the restaurant was also excellent and surprisingly good value, and the staff made you feel you were their personal friends. One quirk was the tacky bar in the corner of the room - which reminded me of Jack & Vera's house in Coronation Street (UK readersd will understand) - but perhaps this is trendy, and I'm not! Not exactly cheap, but a great way to round off our vacation in Canada. P.S. Vancouver is a fabulous city; just a pity it's so far from here!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quakerpaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wedgewood for 5 nights on our recent holiday and whilst it was the most expensive accomodation of our hols it was well worth the money. As said by others the little touches such as cookies and the chocolates on arrival make the place stick in the memory. Great location just off Robson Street makes everywhere walkable in a city that is a joy to walk around. Also had a meal in the hotel restaraunt "Bachus" which was excellent, i'd recommend going for a meal even if your not staying at the hotel, great food in elegant surroundings. All in all a very enjoyable stay in a hotel that has the peresonal touch. On a previous visit we stayed in the Fairmont Waterfront which is another fantastic hotel but i think the Wedgewood pips it for it's little touches as well as it's great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jeff.l
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of our honeymoon in a Wedgewood suite which was fantastic. Nice and large and very comfortable. The room overlooked Robson Square and is only a few minutes walk to Robson street. Very friendly / helpful staff. The cookies at night were gorgeous and a nice touch as was the free net access to check weather / update on lost luggage etc... Jeff.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Napa
Reviews.Content: Visiting family in Vancouver this year we decided to spend a few nights at the Wedgewood....what a delight! This hotel came highly recommended and we were not disappointed very friendly staff who always had a smile, lively bar & restaurant and just lovely rooms. We did not get a room overlooking Robson Square but it didn't matter this place is all about quality, bed linens, marble showers, soaker tubs, furniture and the most comfortable beds. One nice touch is the business center on the second floor, good speed computers are available for guests use at no extra charge, we could stay in touch with our family back in the UK daily without worrying about being charged a fortune. Very well done to everyone at the Wedgewood we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered at this Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location in Vancouver--walking distance to everything. Service was excellent, the box of chocolates and cookies at bedtime divine. The room was very well appointed and the soaking tub relaxing after a day of exploring the city. Went to the spa one afternoon and I fell asleep during my pedicure (never had one lying down before--magnificent) and my husband said his massage was superb. If you want a beautiful boutique hotel in the city that is warm and inviting, not cold and like hotels everywhere, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Raath_ki_Rani
Reviews.Content: The lovely touches everyone talks about are fabulous it's true (a small box of chocolates, bottled water, cookies at bedtime), so it seems stingy to complain about them, but the cookies were stale!!! :) Anyway, on to the real review: I've stayed at the Wedgewood a couple of times. I unqualifiedly loved it the first time about two years ago. This time, a few qualifiers. The king bed was fine but not fantastic. The room itself was large and roomy and nicely appointed (toiletries were quite nice). The view I had was not great. Do definitely try to get a balcony room looking out on to the courtyard. Service was okay, but again not superlative. The first time I stayed here it was superlative. If you get a chance, make reservations and have afternoon tea at Bacchus (the Wedgewood's restaurant). It's really wonderful, with *divine* scones. I'm vegetarian and they very easily catered to my needs. It was really fantastic, though a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “The best that Vancouver has to offer”
Reviews.Author: mari129
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 8 people celebrating my husband's surprise party. This review is from all 8 of us. From the moment that you walk into the foyer and are greeted like family until the very end in which you are wished a wonderful journey, you will enjoy the Wedgewood level of excellence. Our room was quaint with a sitting room large enough for a cocktail party. The Bacchus restaurant was wonderful with excellent service to accompany the cuisine. Best of all was the helpful staff. Smiles and kindness, with attention to the personal details. We would definitely stay at the Wedgwood again.

Reviews.Title: “Overly expensive”
Reviews.Author: madisonken
Reviews.Content: An expensive hotel, but each room with balcony (good for smoking in a non-smoking city), half the balconies overlook beautiful Federal Court square. Good location right downtown. Quiet, with accomodating and professional service. You're paying for what you get. Make sure your room overlooks the square - the other side overlooks office buildings.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Wedgewood for our honeymoon. They upgraded our room at no additional cost and gave a beautiful suite with an amazing bathroom and large balcony. Unfortunately, we were next to a couple of rooms being renovated and were awoken every morning (8 AM) to loud noises. However, it only mildly hampered our stay, as everything else was outstanding. Our first night there we ate at the hotel restaurant and were treated very well. They made us special vegetarian dishes that were definitely 5 star meals. We also received complimentary champagne and dessert once the pianist told them we were on our honeymoon! The room was luxurious and the entire staff was overwhelmingly helpful and friendly. I will definitely be staying there again the next time I'm in Vancouver. I'd recommend this to anyone who can afford a little pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Has it Lost its Star Rating?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In February we returned to the Wedgewood Hotel for a four day stay. Our previous stay at the Wedgewood - just prior to them being awarded a rating as a place to stay by Conde Naste - was tremendous. Unfortunately the hotel seems to have lost its star status- or at least that was our experience. The lobby and the room were needing some care and attention. Obviously the hotel has recognized this as the major problem we experienced was due to renovation. Construction and painting were going on in the room next to ours. A strong smell of paint persisted in our room throughout our four day stay - even over a weekend. When a complaint was made after the first night the staff sent up a machine intended to clean the air, we were told not to be in the room while it was on. We needed to keep the window open when we were in the room resulting in a cold stay. Vancouver was not warm in February. We were not provided with an option of moving rooms - despite this being a four day stay. In addition there was noise throughout the day so a little nap in the afternoon during the holiday was out of the question. Guests should be advised that construction is taking place prior to booking. The prices of the Wedgewood have risen over the years as the hotel has been discovered. Our experience in 2006 does not support the reputation that the hotel now enjoys. Perhaps the renovations will help to keep the hotel at the top but in the meantime guests should be informed that the construction may impact on their comfort and enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended, But Might Try the Waterfront Next”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: Went in with high expectations, primarily from this website, and we were generally quite happy with the Wedgewood. However, if we go back to Vancouver I might try to get a place on the water, instead of in the middle of downtown. On a positive note, the downtown location is within walking distance of both the Seabus to North Vancouver and the Aquabus to Granville Island, not to mention many downtown attractions. However, a downtown location comes with negatives, too, including valet parking, and typical urban core problems like aggressive panhandlers and some pretty undesirable areas within blocks. The hotel itself was very nice. We got a good rate through the Tourism Vancouver website, and, as promised, it was upgraded to a Junior Suite since one was available. We had requested a room on the "nice" side (see other reviews), but none was available so our room overlooked the back alley. Not a deal breaker for us, since we mostly used the room for sleeping. Very comfortable bed, and a nice shower. When we were there (March 10 through 14, 2005), the hotel was undergoing some renovations... one of the two elevators was frequently covered with padding inside. Again, no big deal for us. My partner said she heard some construction noise one morning. The lobby is extremely nice (with a large fireplace), and the bellmen/valets are accommodating and very pleasant. Other than the cost, the valet parking was no problem at all. We called down about 15 minutes before leaving, and the car was always ready and waiting. Front desk staff were knowledgeable, but I felt some of them were a little aloof. Not a lot, but enough to bug me a little. I just didn't feel like all of them went out of their way to be friendly and accommodating despite the small size of the hotel. Turn down service at night with complementary cookies and bottled water; also a complementary box of chocolates upon arrival and a newspaper every day. The turn down service also refreshed towels and bath room supplies at night if needed... a nice touch. Overall we felt the maid service was above average, but a little spotty at times. We would definitely recommend the hotel to prospective visitors. It was a very nice place, and not overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We;ve stayed here twice--once in 2001, as a mini-vacation/2nd honeymoon, and again in December 2004 as a spur of the moment stay--we were driving home from Victoria, BC and decided to spend a night in Vancouver. Both stays were excellent. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous--public areas and the private rooms--tastefully decorated and beautiful. Staff very friendly and quite accomodating, even when we dropped in without reservations. With our honeymoon package we received a lovely piece of Wedgewood porcelain, and both stays we received chocolates and warm cookies in our rooms--also lovely touches like bottled water. This is a truly wonderful hotel in one of my favorite cities. The restaurant is gorgeous, also, and the food is great. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wedgewood Hotel for 5 nights in February 2005 with my husband and my baby son. I have stayed in many great hotels before and I must say that the Wedgewood has been one of the best; I would not hesitate to go back. The room was perfect, with all the commodities but with an extra touch (we stayed in one of the Wedgewood Suites - greatly reduced rates in the winter months!), the service was outstanding (the staff was great with our 18 months old son even though this was clearly not a place where many babies get taken) and the location couldn't be better (right in the middle of all the shops and restaurants in Downtown Vancouver). The little touches we appreciated: being given a private area in the Bacchus restaurant and bar lounge so that we could sip some cocktails while keeping our son with us (children are not admitted in the main bar), the amazing room service (great food from the Bacchus restaurant - the desserts are a pure delight - and the service is faultless), the unexpected baby toiletries in the room, the best blueberry pancakes I've ever tasted and the complementary Belgium chocolates and nightly freshly baked cookies. I did not get to try the spa which I regret and the gym room is a bit small but it does have all the usual required equipment. There is no swimming pool which is a shame but I really don't see where they could fit one anyway. I loved the Bacchus restaurant - for Breakfast, you get to sit in big comfortable armchairs by the fireplace (with a roaring fire in it in the winter!). Although we didn't get to eat there in the evenings because of our son's bedtimes, the restaurant certainly was very popular, always full, with live piano music every night. We had the opportunity to sample the food via Room Service and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Wedgewood makes you feel special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stepping into the Wedgewood is to step into an oasis of calm, where staff remember who you are and greet you by name. You feel as if you are returning to a stately old, gracious home. The hotel is beautifully and tastefully refurbished. Bathrooms are modern and elegant. The "mod cons" are present, but ever so discreet. Suites and guest rooms are luxuriously comfortable. There is a suberb restaurant, with an award winning chef, where the food is always outstanding. The restaurant is decorated Victorian style, with comfortable sofas and armchairs. It provides both casual or intimate dining spaces, especially if one is lucky enough to be seated in front of the beautiful fireplace. And then there is the spa. To the weary traveller, there's no better place to relax! The Wedgewood is truly a gem, situated in the heart of Vancouver's shopping, business and entertainment areas. A beautiful hotel in a beautiful location for those lucky enough to experience it and its special ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to stay at the Wedgewood hotel a short while ago and would highly recommend it to those looking for a more superior but personal hotel. Located centrally in downtown Vancouver the Hotel is located next to some of Vancouver’s best shopping and dining. On arrival we were greeted by polite, efficient and friendly staff and shown to our room, which was in fact a suite as it contained two bathrooms, one which opened via shutters into the bedroom, the large bedroom contained an extremely comfortable king sized bed; the room also had a sitting room and balcony. The obvious quality of the fixtures stood out and the cookies at the side of the bed were a nice touch. The service was second to none; nothing was too much for the staff, who obviously take pride in the hotel. The hotel has a classic feel to it with its sumptuous décor and visitors must sample the Bacchus Restaurant, we tried out their afternoon tea which was a definite hit. Whether you are using this hotel for business or personal use you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “the B E S T ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: what a treat to have such a fabulous hotel and it its not in bangkok. all expectations surpassed,staff perfection,facilities spectacular,and most of all they care from bellman to maids to managment.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Padong
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my expectations were too high.... After a month's travelling and trying all sorts of hotels throughout Europe, I hate to say it, but I was very disappointed with the Wedgewood. We were given a junior suite with a full terrace. This should have been great but the terrace was so plain - quite ugly - the outlook on buildings - in my view, without any charm. Sadly, indoors, much about our large room looked slightly tired - the desk noticeably damaged and the bedspread slightly frayed. There were several mixups - our cookies were missed althogether one night; on another only one of us received these. No complimentary slippers were provided. That earlier reviewer was also right about only artifical flowers on each lobby floor and the plastic rubbish bins in the bathrooms - what a pity! Even the pens appeared to be 'bottom of the range'. We were also left embarrassingly hungry after our tiny (though tasty) portions when we ordered room service for dinner. Service was adequate but I have had better. We were told we would need to ask for the twice daily room servicing as this was not automatic (no ice when we came in for a lunchtime drink!) The doorman was not always on duty and did not remember us by name despite our stay of a few days. However, the dead lightbulb we found when arrived was changed promptly. I was so looking forward to staying at the Wedgeweood but doubt I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not nearly a great value for the money. The staff smiles more than it performs and made some mistakes that embarassed us and the couple in the room to which they sent us. Lots of apologies, but clearly, practiced and symbolic politeness. The room itself was in fact no better than many others for much, much less in Vancouver, and not nearly the quality of niche hotels there and in Seattle. The bar was friendly and good, the continental breakfast average and it was nice to get the chocolates and cookies with turndown. But, it's not nearly the value of other niche hotels in the city, or even some of its nearby, traditional competitors. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Extrodinary Wedgewood!”
Reviews.Author: PasadenaLion
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood Hotel is a small, intimate, luxury hotel that lives up to its reputation. The hotel is exquisite with old-world beauty in its deep wood panelling and textured wallpaper. Yet has all the modern conveniences to which we have become accustomed. The rooms are bright, spacious, beautifully decorated and very comfortable. It is wonderfully maintained. The staff is gracious and accomodating and will greet you by name and make you feel as if you owned the flat. It is a bit pricey but well worth it if you want to indulge a loved one or yourself.

Reviews.Title: “A class act”
Reviews.Author: TConetta
Reviews.Content: The Wedgewood Hotel is a true class act. The hotel is charming and elegant, the staff highly professional, and the service outstanding. Few hotels these days provide a level of service comparable to The Wedgewood. They truly make each guest feel special. We were traveling with our 8-year old daughter and she was made to feel very welcome. She even had her own plate of cookies by her bed each night, and the clothing she left behind in a drawer was located by housekeeping and promptly shipped to Florida. The location is terrific, especially if you like shopping. Be sure to snag a window table in the restaurant for afternoon tea and people watching. It's especially lovely in the summer when they open the windows. We visited during a family tour of the Northwest, but my husband and I will definitely return for a romantic trip for two...hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a relative steal at $200CND per night. The staff is fantastic--very knowledgeable about the area and glad to share it. We actually had one breathless bellman run after us up the street when he forgot to give us a detail he wanted us to know. Little things like a "welcome" box of truffles, and turndown service replete with cookies and bottled water add to the charm of this cozy and extremely well-located hotel. The only negative was an uninspired, rushed, and overpriced massage at the Spa. Of course, a massage is only as good as the person providing the service, so maybe we just got unlucky. But I don't want to end on a negative: the Wedgewood is a find.

Reviews.Title: “Simply lovely”
Reviews.Author: Emgoose
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Wedgewood during a recent holiday to Canada. We were extremely impressed with the hotel. It has a lovely atmosphere, it is small, personal, the staff are very friendly and it felt like a home from home. Our junior suite was lovely. Extremely spacious, and comfortable and it didn't feel like just another hotel room. The hotel also benefits from being in a fantastic location right in the center of downtown, which helped make exploring Vancouver very easy. P.S the cookies at turndown are super!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent start to a Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got married over the July 4th weekend and spent a few absolutely wonderful days and nights at the Wedgewood Hotel. My new husband and I decided to pamper ourselves in town at the Wedgewood before we set forth on our honeymoon. The room we were provided was luxurious and the service was top notch. We both relaxed in the expert hands of the masseurs at the spa and enjoyed sumptious dinners at Bacchus Restaurant in the hotel. By the way, Bacchus has the best martinis in town! I can't wait to book us in for our first anniversary celebration.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A superb small hotel in Vancouver that is a welcome change from the big boxes. Our week-end escape was made memorable by the hotel's friendly knowledgeable staff, great restaurant and personalized attention you can only get in a top class property. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were sadly disappointed in this hotel, after I read rave reviews about how fantastic this hotel was and there is none like it in B.C. I planned this trip for our fifth year anniversary and wanted to be pampered. The spa was excellent, but I truly could not understand how this hotel could be rated above 3-star. We paid for a suite, which was over $350/US nightly, so, we expected five star service, food and accommodations. The service was lack luster, the room was very clean but definitely not fancy. The food, which for dinner we paid over $100 to eat in our room, not including drinks, was so-so. One great aspect which stood out in my mind, was the housekeeping supervisor. Our bed was awful so when we called the following day, she switched out our bed with the only pillow top in the hotel. We were thankful for her consideration, but decided to cut our trip short. We left two days earlier than scheduled and ended up spending our last two days at our favorite hotel, Bellevue Club in Bellevue, WA. We spent half the money we did in Bellevue and received two times the service, food quality and comfortable night stay. If you are used to four+ star hotels, you may want to continue looking before plunking down the four-star money here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wedgewood”
Reviews.Author: Barry & David
Reviews.Content: Our room and service was excellent. Great location!!!!!!
